reviews.review: Excellent place for dinner because of its variety of places!!!. Nice view and better places for lunch and dinner. We really had a good time eating and drinking. New Years Eve is full of people and everybody is having fun. Better do reservations!
Safe and beautiful environment . It's very safe and beautiful environment around here. Love the river view so much. I wish it's not rainy day right now so we can spend our time by the river.
It's ok. It's nice to walk around and to visit if you're new to the city, but shops are very expensive and not so varied.

Great choice of restaurants. It was nice to stroll along the Puerto Madero and equally nice to dine Al Fresco and people watch. Our favourite was happy hour (I think it was 5-8pm) at Asia de Cuba - which is next to/part of the Hilton hotel. The sushi for 2 plus 2 mini bottles of champagne deal was nice as a snack there -approx £18, the champagne was 'Chandon' which was surprisingly nice!
TGI Friday. Wonderful place in a luxury neiborhood. Go there everytime I can. Prices not expensive. The crew is the best. The food even better.

Romantic stroll around. If you feel like taking a beautifulAnd relaxing stroll around a marina that's a great option! All restaurants are ready to make easy money with you.Go cross the ponte de las mujeres then leave the marina for the casino in Palermo and eat lunch there at Tucson Steak house!
Very modern. Recently developed and very upmarket part of the city. Lots of apartments restaurants shops, cafes etc... Worth a look as quite a different atmosphere to the rest of the city.
Different Buenos Aires. Great area that is very different from other parts of Buenos Aires. Very modern, clean and safe. There is a lot of restaurants and bars in the area. Definitely worth visiting!

Very Nice Area. A very nice area within Buenos Aires. Safe to walk around day or night. Several restaurants in the area, walking distance to Galerias Pacificas. Area can get congested with roller bladers, joggers and teenagers.

Piles of rubbish in tne water greeted us.. It a poorly developed marina, not very attractive by world standards.Grey buildings, drab surroundings. The developers did as little?e as they could to make an attractive give place, another story of lack of funds D's no doubt t, so typical of South America.Worth a visit, to be brutally honest NO.

Great view. Great time. I think that everyday I went to Puerto Madero. O loved the view, the atmosphere, the bars, the restaurants, everything. This is a really place to have a sit and just enjoy a glass of wine or a cold draft beer. Don't forget to cross the bridges and walk around.
Excelent place. I got lunch in the side where open air restaurants, they are very good and I loved Imarket. Fish and chicken very nice and the wine has a good price.

It is safe enough to walk around during daytime.. The place is not that especially. I am a little disappointed. I think a lot of western cities have their own versions of port. Their versions of port are probably prettier than this one. The port in Barcelona is way better and nicer looking, more activities to do and better shops.Puerto Madero is not a must see. If you are in the area, you can check it out. It gets windy. Dress warm. I still give it 3 points because it is a safe place to walk around. There are a lot of navy police in the area to guard visitors'' safety.Puerto Madero is a tourist trap with a lot of expensive restaurants. The only inexpensive eats are fast food restaurants.
Great contrast. A good place to go to just enjoy the area with the abundance of restaurants. Also you see the locals exercising and just sitting and relaxing.
U're in bs.as u must visit here. U're in bs.as u must visit here. Is a nice place, for a walk. Nice view. A lots of coffee houses and restaurants.
Cool and Trendy. Puerto Madero is a cool and trendy spot in Buenos Aires. Full of amazing restaurants and fantastic night life
Looking for Amalia Fortabat Museum. We walked around Puerto Madero searching for the Fortabat museum. It is a beautiful area to walk with family, to run and to appreciate the view.

Just another modernized dock area. The coolest thing here is watching the road open up to allow boats to pass. Otherwise it is all pretty normal. A few chain places to eat or drink coffee, and interesting to compare it to toher modernized docks, but nothing special.
For a walk. I went here for a walk each morning after work in Buenos Aires. It is the best part of Buenos Aires. Expensive but wonderful.

Architectural Beauty gets Better. Puerto Madero is the second oldest harbor of Buenos Aires. Left unattended for year, after the harbor moved to its new location, the old warehouses lining the harbour had fallen in ruin. The old eyesore was turned into a tourist attraction where the old warehouses were rehabilitated and put to use as restaurants, offices, boutiques and the like. A safe, wonderful area for a stroll and a meal at just about any time for lunch and dinner, the area has been developed tremendously in the last ten years from my last visit. What is new is the far bank, which before only contained the Hilton Hotel, sitting lonely away from the action on the opposite bank, is now chuck full of new buildings. This area has stunning contemporary architecture where office buildings mix with apartment buildings and mix use commercial such as restaurants, shops, offices, etc. It became a vibrant, safe and luxurious neighborhood of BA. Highly recommended for locals and tourists alike. When here, one can do worse than schedule a dinner at the most famous restaurant and temple of steak, Cabana Las Lilas. Many other restaurant options abound. There are two old sailing ships that can be visited as well. Perhaps the best is watching people as on weekends particularly BA families use this area as a strolling place in addition to wonderful prolonged lunches at any of the many restaurants.

Kind of a tourist trap. Compared to the other sights in Buenos Aires, this area was kind of a let down. We went during the day, and were underwhelmed by the restaurant options (I bet that is much better at night). The tour of the ship was interesting (and inexpensive), but besides walking around there is not a lot to do here.

Good place to stay for first timers to BA. I stayed in this area as it was my first visit to BA. It is a regenerated dockside area, very pleasant and lovely for a stroll in the evening with some interesting bridges and old ships along the river. Like most modern regenerated dockside areas they tend to lack the particular characteristics of the country or city you are in due to generic hotel, food and shop chains, but we did find some real gems in this area that made us feel very much in Argentina. We found this area a good place to stay and it was just a few minutes walk to the pink palace.
The place to stay. Nice, safety, order, modern and clean.You can walk, run it rollers.A very nice building and parks, with a very wide green areas
Great afternoon walk. You can visit Fragata Sarmiento and after that take a walk by the seaport, have an expensive coffe or a beer waiting for the sunset. You'll love it.

A great area in BA. This area in BA was down trodden for many years and was resurrected about 30 hears ago into upper end restaurants, offices and apartments. The walk along the canals is great and there are two historical ships tied up to take tours on. Also a very uniques bridge can be seen. Well worth the visit.

My favorite place in whole Buenos Aires!. It's a beautiful harbor with many many good restaurants and nice architecture. The restaurants are not cheap but have food (especially steaks) with really high quality. It's beautiful to walk there in the evening - usually really quiet and peaceful.

Great for strolling and eating. Very nice area to walk around on a sunny day. The docks have been restored very well. Lots of cafes and restaurants. I was there on a Sunday and it was very busy. Definitely a must see

Beautiful night views. We visited Puerto Madero while on our Latin America trip. Its a wonderful place to spend an evening in BA. The night view is lovely with brightly lit bridges and reflections of the surrounding buildings on the water giving a mirror like effect.There are a lot of restaurants and bars n pubs around the water bay and perfect for spending an eve in the city.Definetely a must visit when in BA.

Old and new.. Puerto Madero is part of the old port of the city. They completely renovated the old warehouses, put a Calatrava bridge and transformed the place into a very pleasant recreational area. In a walking distance from the city center it was our daily stroll.
New but already at the top. Trendy restaurants, fine museums (some of them with free admittance), lots of security, in the heart of town. A must if you enjoy a night out.

Nice area to wander. Like many cities Buenos Aires has done a great job of tidying up some of its waterfront - the area is now slick and modern, and as is the norm also now pretty soulless, filled with Starbucks and generic restaurants. However, it is still a nice place to walk around and enjoy the boats and people-watching after a day of sight-seeing elsewhere.
City Port. I found this area very similar to the docks in Dublin and it turns out that they had the same architect. Nice for a quiet stroll with a coffee.
Awesome sunset. To walking around and make great photos, a lot of couples in love goes to see the sunset. There is a bridge dedicated to woman and some old ships.
Relax and nature. Enjoy your days in Buenos Aires having a drink in the open either by day or at night air Great sights, nature and good foodAlso appealing to go with your family
Great. Best beighborhood in Buenos Aires. I love this city and I love its people, I will come back soon! gracias ezequiel paratu recomendcion

I saw nothing special about it. Old warehouses turned into condos with some upscale restaurants. While it was a nice place to walk around, I didn't see anything spectacular about it other than the turn of the century cranes.

Pretty in a sterile way. This review is only for the new part of Puerto madero. I found it to be pretty but sterile. Nice new buildings. No retail, vendors or outdoor activities. I understand people live in this expensive enclave for its safety and exclusivity but I would rather take my chances in the real BA across the bridge. This place just invites class warfare

JUST TRENDY AND VIBRANT ! JUST BS AS !. Part of an ambitious city renovation plan, PUERTO MADERO became a major business, trendy fashion, shopping and restaurant district; ideal for your pictures, old warehouses which became the most sought after lofts to live, vibrant any time of the day !

Great dining area . When you see locals queueing to eat you know that it must be good. This area along waterfront was recommended to us by the hotel staff. Nice easy walk from hotel and a variety of high end eateries. Only sampled wine and finger foods but very enjoyable. Heading back to Le grill buenos aires for dinner.

A fun place to wander!. We crossed the Woman's Bridge, ate at a good restaurant, shopped in better-than-souvenir shops, and enjoyed seeing the boats moored on the canal. The statues and art work on one side of the bridge were definitely picture-worthy. We were there for 3 hours and the lights of the boats went on just as the sun went down in a pink-gold sky. Magical!

Liveable neighbourhood. Generally a very safe area in Buenos Aires, it pullulates with restaurants, cafès and food kiosks, as well as with some of the best hotels in town.It features a pedestrian area along the river for walkers and runners to enjoy and is very green.Plaza de Mayo is close by, and so is the port: ideal base to explore Buenos Aires.

nice any time of the year. A more budget friendly option is to simply get an ice cream and walk around the area. You have a nautical museum on a boat, which is interesting, you can go to "puente de la mujer" or simply enjoy the sunset. Its also a great spot to enjoy Christmas and New years fireworks :)

A must if you're visiting Buenos Aires.. The newest and most modern area of Buenos Aires. It has dozens of restaurants and bars located around the river in the once abandoned and neglected Puerto Madero. Totally different than the old world charm and elegance you get at the better recognized areas of Bs. As. such as Palermo and Recoleta, but very nice nevertheless.
Great place to visit and eat. It's very different from the city itself, and is great to spend a sunny afternoon walking around and eating.
Amazing Place. It is a great place to be either for business or pleasure. Great restaurants, nice scenery and safe place to walk around.
Love it. I love Pùerto madoro full of great restaurants and I have to admit Argentinian meat is the best of the world... great! I loved it! I had a great month here
Modern Wharf Precinct. Pleasant place to spend a sunny afternoon having lunch and walking along the promenade. Lots of choices of eateries. Close to the city square and pedestrian mall.

Ideal place to go for a walk. This is an incredible area to go for a walk or to do excersice.Recently remodelated, is surrounded by restaurants, cafes and other kind of shops, and the river in the other side with its bpoats gives a pleasant view for everybody.

Great area for to grab a coffee and for a walk. I was at the University at an event. Very nice place to go out for a walk and grab a coffee. Lots of restaurants around with lost of budget options for you to pick from. If weather is nice you can get a nice long walk. I would say a must to see when you are in Buenos Aires.

The most expensive neighborhood in town. The new skycrapers combined with old british style docks recuperated, several hotels, restaurants, coffee shops, museums, green parks, besides the river shore with yatchs and boats, make this place unique. It is located close to downtown but the atmosphere is complete different. You can enjoy both lunch or dinner, in any of the most sophisticated places in town. It is a must if you visit Buenos Aires city.

Singapore of Argentina. Reminds me of the kind of areas that you find in any big city that are a bit sterile and very wealthy and gorgeous. The kind of beautiful place where international finance people come and live while they are working... but pretty devoid of Argentine culture from what I could surmise.

For those who love "aperitivo" and sunsets. Take the 2 or 103 and get down in front of the UCA or any subtle line that gets you close to Plaza de Mayo. Go there to take a walk alone, with friends or with your family or to do a jogging session. Wait for sunset and enjoy the skyline.For students: go study at the library of the UCA (bring your ID), and the walk down to one of the many bars close to the canal to have a few beers.

Romantic for a couple out for dinner. We walked Puerto Madero looking for a place to stop for dinner. Loads of options for varied pockets. The place is lovely, safe and clean! We returned during the day and visited the ship (10 pesos entry). Will return for sure
Beautiful at night. New port area with beautiful renovated old buildings converted to homes offices and restaurants and bars. Site of touristy tango show. Worth a visit.

Great area for walking!. Super close to Plaza de Mayo for seeing all of the sights there including Casa Rosada. Open areas for walking along the river with lots of restaurants. Close by you can take a boat to Montevideo. Very convenient location.

This is practically a new area, not older than tn years that used to be customs warehouses.. I live quite neat this place and try to go twice a month, generally on Sundays since it is on weekends that most people visit the place, full of excellent restaurants and the famous "Puente de la Mujer" (Woman's Bridge)

An evening stroll . We wandered down through here on out way to the Buquebus to Uruguay...A modern version of the old waterfront now exists.Many a good restaurant line the once ported shores.Good for a casual stroll, afternoon run, lunch date or evening meal...

Long walkway but not many shops or opportunities to sightsee. this long canal street showcases beautiful boats but does not include access to Rio La Plata - long walk boardwalk with scenic nature but if you are in search of shops this may not be the place to go. Great exercise option and some good restaurants on the boardwalk
Good walking . Good place to walk and have dinner.It is close to Casada Rosada and can be a good opportunity for a long walk along the rio.

food and seaside. its a nice spot if you want a nice selection of restaurants with a pretty view, you will not have typical food there since is very turist trappy and not child-friendly but overall a nice experience

Underwhelmed . I was underwhelmed by Puerto Madero, we accidentally went on a night when there were protestors blocking all access roads in, so only pedestrians on foot were in the area. We should've gone back at a different time when it may have been more "buzzing".. There were plenty of nice places to eat, all looking over a fairy nice area. Would be a good place for a romantic dinner for two.
Coffee . Its nice stralling around at Puesto Madero. There are lots of restaurants and cafes. It would be even nicer to walk around in spring time.

Decent area, surprisingly good reviews. Having walked Buenos Aires' beautiful streets for several days, I was really looking forward to seeing Puerto Madero. It was nice but lacked the 'wow' factor. Perhaps it is because I am from the UK - the area is just like Salford Docks, the area around ExCel in East London or the docks in Glasgow.
Pleasant Neighboorhood. Take a walk along the shoreline and enjoy the view of the buildings old and new. Lots of places to eat and some fine hotels along here.

Touristy area; more modern & expensive. Puerto Madera is the more modern and expensive area of BA. As such it is also more touristy. I prefer older areas with more charm so I wasn't as in love with Puerto Madero as it didn't seem to offer anything unique -- even the waterfront could be any waterfront in a major city anywhere in the world. We had pre-paid for our hotels before coming, but I wouldn't stay in Puerto Madero if we came back to BA.
Great place to eat meat. This place is the best to eat meat in Buenos Aires, the empanadas are great as well as the service. We loved it so we came back next day.
Beautiful Area. It is fantastic walking along Puerto Madero on a sunny day. There are plenty of places to sit along the river side and enjoy this wonderful city.

Nice Area. This area has been redeveloped into a nice area where you can talk a stroll and enjoy the river canal, shops, and restaurants. I didn't think there was anything special about this place. It felt safe during the day and there are a couple of Naval vessels that you can tour for a very cheap price. If your in this location, it would be nice to stop by, but don't go out of your way to come here.
I love this area!!!. If you come to Argentina this is a most. Lots of restaurants and open areas to walk. The bridge is awesome!!! Nice for family time.

Beautiful for a Sunday stroll!. Loved Puerto Madero. It's a massive island accessible by a few bridges. I visited it on a bike tour and I'd say biking is probably the best way to see it all in a reasonable amount of time. There are a few very good (and very expensive) restaurants by the entrance but the food trucks are also a great, cheaper option and the food is to die for!

It's okay. I guess BA doesn't have a lot of places on the water. The Puerto Madero scene is built along a canal. Porteños longing for all things French surfaces even in the area's modern architecture.Even though we stayed here for business, it was not our favorite area of the city. Tourists would probably enjoy staying and eating in Palermo Soho and Recoleta more.

Beautiful . Puerto madero is next to the old docks of buenos Aires. The place is beautiful and gets a real life and nice atmosphere in the evening, when the sun gets down. You can find many super nice restaurant there and bars. It is a good place for the dinner.

Go for a walk, and more!. Puerto Madero is worth visiting. Ideal for a walk on a nice day. Great for lunch or dinner, plenty of options, particularly known for upscale restaurants but there is also a wide variety of mid-priced places. If you are up to either museums and/or ships do not hesitate to visit the Fortabat Collection and the Fragata Sarmiento.
Former port area great for jogging. Very cool docks area of BA which has been done up and refurbished with beautiful restaurants, parks and views of the city. Great place for jogging too.
Great Sunday afternoon walk & visit. We had a lovely time walking around Puerto Madero. Great time w a group of kids. lots of places to roam and wander.
Nice view & decent food . Great fish options. Good meat options. Decent prices. Didn't rock our boat, but solid. English menus. Setting on the river. Had a good first lunch in Argentina.
Gorgeous sites.. We really enjoyed strolling along the waterways and taking picture after picture, it is spectacular at night. Our only complaint was the legion of zombies looking for Pokemon.

Excellent. Really nice! I recommend to go here on a sunday or saturday at lunchtime, spend some time walking and seeing some maritime attractions , and then eat in some of the delicious restaurants. It's better when it's sunny, and I don't recommend going there at rainy days, unless you only want to go to restaurants.

Amazing view. This is THE place to go when thw weather is nice and you feel like strolling around the city by the river. Plenty of cafés and restaurants, as well as small seats by the river to just sit and watch the people go by.
Beautiful place, expensive restaurants. The port is certainly Beautiful, but had some really expensive restaurants. Best time to go is sunset.
One ir the most beautiful places in Buenos Aires. A beautiful place to go, full of restaurants, nice place For running with a beautiful View. Woman Bridge is there, nice place yo take photos

Great area to take pics . If you are short of time, you need to visit Puerto Madera to gets some of the best pics of the city. The area is very safe and full with security guards making it ideal for family.
Lovely. Such a pretty area! There is a beautiful bridge, and it is worth taking a walk around. Good restaurants too.

Must go at least once. Puerto Madero is a beautiful neighborhood that feels very different from the rest of Buenos Aires. It's very modern. Wouldn't recommend eating there if you're on a budget, since it's targeted for tourists willing to spend (which i'm not 😁).
Nice place to wlak around. Recommeneded to take a nice walk around. It if safe and there are lot´s or restaurants. It is pretty near downtown, just a walking distance.
walk by the water!. Enjoy the view, the people, the good restaurants. All kinds of foods, particularly good are the meat & sea food.

Nice neighborhood. Nice to walk around any time of the day, I prefer in the afternoon before sunset. There is some interesting places to visit, don't miss Puente de la Mujer and Fragata Sarmiento. Lots of nice rather pricey restaurant.

Brunch. Puerto Madero is a very fancy classy attraction in Buenos Aires.
One of the most visited places, has an excellent choice of food. Local and international, fast and gourmet.
Excellent for a sunny day to walk and roller around.
For a rainy day to sit under the gazebo with a hot coffee.
What's New in BA?. Puerto Madero is new...er. We enjoyed the stroll around this area. All new buildings, a wonderful monument to Anne Frank, the bridge to cross into Puerto Madero is beautiful.
Celebrating the New Year. I were very privileged to celebrate the new year 2016 in Puerto Madero. What a wonderful experience, so far away from home! An unforgettable experience!
Great Puerto Madero. I love walking by Pùerto Madero we had lunch at Cabana Las Lilas I think the meat was super juicy, the way I love it!
Modern views. Modern views, excelebt place for going To have dinner, excelent restaurants, excellent drinks and very fun and sophisticated people
Amazing but super expensive. From Puerto Madero Baires seems a totally different city.. Beautiful sunsets, nice places to eat at every hour of the day and night... Si tienen plata!
nice place for a sunset. If you are a sunset lover U have to definately go there around 5-6pm to catch a perfect lights and the docks buildings mirroed in the water :)

Beautiful and modern . Buenos Aires is a very eclectic city and Puerto Madero is the modern area. Seems to have been a refurbished warehouse district with residential buildings and restaurants. Nice to walk along and take pics. Don't miss Fragata Sarmiento and The bridge.
Lovely area. Well worth a walk around.. THIs is a really interesting part Of Buenos Aires and well worth a walk around to contrast it with the rest of the city. Lovely at sunset.

Beautiful port. This is port that was renovated many years ago and is a nice place to go dine with a large selection of restaurants. There are also souvenir shops. There was a large sailboat from 1897 moored there that you can visit for $2 . President Taft once boarded that boat from the pictures seen inside. Nice visit.
Nice mix of new architicture and nature.... The old port has been redeveloped with modern buildings andere some nice bars and restaurants. Nice for biking...also tot the nature reserve behind it.

Lovely place to spent an afternoon. We visited Puerto Madero on a cool but sunny afternoon in July. It was lovely to stroll wharf side. There we a good number of restaurant choices. There was some fixed marine exhibits including an Argentinian barque, and a boat from Uruguay, both were open to the public for viewing.

Some of the Best Restaurants in Buenos Aires water views. Puerto Madero is an old shipping warehouse district that has been remodeled and updated and is now home to most of the finest restaurants in Buenos Aires. All of the restaurants have an indoor area as well as a covered outdoor area in the back facing the water channels where ships used to load and unload there ware's. You can walk in the back area of the restaurants and enjoy the view or just sit on a bench and watch the people go by.

Interesting. Good to walk around, but probably better early evening as there are bars lining the walkway.
We went in the afternoon.
Still developing
Lovely place. Lovely place to visit in Bsas. Great structure, amazing restaurantes e a beautifully scenario make this place a must in Bsas.
Lovely area. Puerto Madero is a lovely area. One of the best in Buenos Aires. It's very safe, very picturesque and a lot to do. Very convenient to everything. Definitely worth spending time in.

On the water, but a bit run down. This area needs to be better maintained, and cleaned up. It is close to the theater district, but I'm not sure how safe it would be to walk around in the night. Lots of good restaurants are here.

Top trip tango. This late night tango show is a must not miss! After erring at the cost we decided to do the VIP option (on a two for one) and we're rather impressed. The show was narrated in Spanish so we were a little lost on what was going on but still thoroughly enjoyed the Broadway style show. Food was surprisingly good three courses bread and unlimited drinks! They wherever forthcoming with the drinks as well replacing the bottle if bubbles before it was finished.
If you visit Buenos Aires it's a must. Puerto Madero is a reburbished ancient Port, now full of offices and restaurants, it's worth to walk along the inner channel and enjoy the views

Hangout. Great place to hangout everyday after work (4-5pm) go grab a drink at the pub (located opposite the convenience store), they do serve decent bar food by the way (go for the garlic peppers squid, nice). They do have some 'ladies drinks' as well like Mojito so grab a partner along and do some people watching over there. Oh ya, the waitress are very very friend too. Met couple of new friends there (mostly foreigners not local Argentinians). This place is otherwise quiet on weekends, except for that Italian restaurant during lunch time where there's complimentary opera singing performance.
Nice dock with a lot of restaurants . A good walking spot, several options to eat, a boat museum, near the center of the city. A good place to go while in Buenos Aires.

Wait a while. Puerto Madero was part of Buenos Aires Port in the old days. The area was abandoned for a long time and developed later as the most modern part of the city: many high-rises and towers that were bought by politicians and business; many restaurants some good, some terrible. The Catholic University bought part of the old warehouse buildings so students walking around is one of the good aspects of the area. In general it's a safe area because there's money in it.There's nothing much to see, and I'd say to wait a while before wasting time visiting to see if it becomes worth the effort.

Enjoying Puerto Madero. Very nice and safe place to walk and enjoy a good meal.In Spring and Summer time, most restaurants with outside tables, will host bands and other shows making the place very enjoyable.

Nice área for doing sport. A nice and safe area in the city for a walk or to go with rollers or bicycle,
You can also find very good restaurants, good quality.

Puerto Madero, a must in Buenos Aires. Reminiscent of the London docks, Puerto Madero is a place with a charm on its own. The old harbor buildings have been turned into fashionable apartments, shops, and restaurants. On the other side of the docks, a new neighborhood of high-rise buildings and luxurious four-story apartment dwellings emerged in the '90s. And it is still growing.You can have lunch or dinner on the terrace of one of the many excellent restaurants, enjoying the view and the fresh unpolluted air. After that, a walk along the docks will prove a nice experience either by day or by night.

Madero hotel. We stayed here for 7 nights, comfortable and relaxed. Great location and felt very safe at night. Close to the water so plenty of options for running in the morning . It was starting to get quite cold when we arrived so the restaurants were quite empty. Didn't bother us though as the food was still plentiful and tasty. Close to the ferry building if you want to travel to Uruguay. Close enough to la boca stadium to watch the football.
Otimo. Best place to visit and eat in Buenos Aires, there's a lot of restaurants, a little expensive, but with a singular argentine meat.

Just to take a look . It's a small city inside of a big city. A recovered neighborhood that gives a modern upgrade to Buenos Aires. Lot of places to have a coffee, restaurants and a quiet side of the porteños!

Quiet by day, hectic by night. Puerto Madero is the old wharf area of Buenos Aires. Derelict warehouses and riverside quays have been converted into office buildings and glamorous restaurants. Geographically distributed along the whole area are loading cranes to keep the atmosphere of the old use of the river, and one of the iconic ships of the Argentinian Navy, the Uruguay, is open to visit. A very niceplace for a stroll and also for exercising.

Beautiful!. Beautiful for walking around and watching the sunset on a warm afternoon. I went in the winter so it is pretty cold and windy, but still a great place to visit! There are many restaurants there too!
Good. Good site very cultural the river is a dirty brown color .. buildings and atmospher was enlightning if in buenos aires make the effort

The London dock lands in B.A.. This former harbor area has been renovated and upgraded into an area for dining and walking a promenade. Most restaurants seem Italian. The atmosphere of the harbor has been preserved. Eye catchers are the museum ship and Calatrava bridge. Not many people seem to live in this area on walking distance of Plaza de Mayo and during the day the area is rather empty.
Beautiful view. One place you should take a afternoon to walk around, finishing the visit at any restaurant close to the river. Loved the view of modern buildings among historical architecture.

Great. This place is one of the better places to lunch, drink or take aromantic moment.
Is safe.
Many restaurants with very good level.
You can walk or run safe at nivht too.
Perfect place for a nice still!. Perfect day and night and any weather! There's a great choice of elegant restaurants along the port, and great views!

Awesome! . One of the places you must visit in Buenos Aires, refurbished and modernized the port area became o must visit for tourists and locals alike who join for an evening stroll alongside the channels that once were the main port of Buenos Aires
Great restaurants, clean and safe!
A nice place to Walk. Is a nice city you can Eat Pizza and walk arround, enjoy the architecture everithing is beautifor in Buenos Aires

Generic harborside development. It's a tried (yet in my opinion, not always true) recipe: grab an old piece of unused historic dockland, convert the warehouses into shops and restaurants, keep a couple trappings like cranes and piers, then sell the land around it at a premium for office development and apartments. Strong feeling of deja vu when visiting.

Beautiful Evening on the river. Had a lovely meal and evening on the river. Fortunately, the weather was mild and had a nice walk along the pier and across the Women's Bridge. It is a stunning area with lots of nice restaurants and very safe.
Lovely area. Good option for night bars and restaurants and during the day we used the terminal to go to Colonia. Good infrastructure.

Restaurant Row and great people Watching. Sat by the water for drinks and a few meals. Lots of sail boats and yachts along the peirs. Great people watching . Lovers, tourist, just plain folks having a walk and very laid back.

Get connected with the river. Nice and pretty safe area to walk around and enjoy a bit of the river. Full of nice expensive restaurants and tourists, although fun to spend a nice afternoon with friends or couple.

Least interesting part of the city. This place has no character, I've got no idea why it's no 2 of things to do. There are tonnes of unique and interesting places in BsAs, this suburb could from any modern city in the world.

Short trip. This area of town is popular with the younger up and coming crowd. You can easily walk around and cab rides are cheap. The shopping area is within walking distance for those used to exercising. You are located along the waterway and there is a "promenade" area nearby.
Nice and calm. Just a couple of blocks away from downtown this part of the city is very nice and calm. There are plenty of restaurants, mainly expensive ones.

Nice place for a walk or dinner. Puerto Madero is the old port of Buenos Aires that was actually never used as a port. Nice port-like buildings create an interesting setting for a walk and there is an abundance of mainstream/chain restaurants. But not much otherwise. A immigration museum at the north edge may be worth a visit.
Awesome Place to Visit in Buenos Aires. This is a must see in Buenos Aires. You will find several incredible restaurants: seafood, steak houses and Italian in a beautiful renovated setting.
divino. Nice architecture , close to downton, for a walk, for a romantic dinner, for runners, there are huge hotels, and excelent restaurants

Average. This area is nice enough to walk around but to speak of a topsight, eh no. There are some good erstaurants and shops and the park in front is also quite nice but I wouldn't say you must visit this place

Nice to watch, boring to stay. Nice architecture, the parc is also nice to walk through. You see a lot of runners and dogwalkers here. Very posh neighbourhood for the Argentinean jetset. I saw it with a tour and it's clear that most locals don't really like the high class that lives here.

Great to walk around and wonderful restaurants!. Close to my hotel so I was able to spend my first jet lagged day walking around and seeing some sites in Buenos Aires. The restaurants are plentiful in the area and very good. Not the cleanest area though.

A lot to offer. Nice and safe area. A lot of restaurants, but often more expensive. Some shopping, I shopped at Havanna and the winery. Close to the boats to Colonia. Nice bridge and museum ships. You can walk to other attractions like Florida or Plaza de Majo.

Nice walk. A nice place to walk around and choose a restaurant, there are so many. A canal runs through it and an old sailing ship turned into a museum is well worth a look, only about a dollar entry.
People always seem happy here, not in so much of a rush. Nice visit.

Nice walk. A nice place to walk around and choose a restaurant, there are so many. A canal runs through it and an old sailing ship turned into a museum is well worth a look, only about a dollar entry.
People always seem happy here, not in so much of a rush. Nice visit.
Boring. Nothing much to see here. Lots of tourists tat. Don't go out of your way to visit. Nothing of great quality.
Great for views and a plethora of fantastic restaurants. A beautiful area with great views of the port and converted old buildings. Sooo many fantastic restaurants.

Beautiful Area, great restaurants. Great area to stay. Very safe and secure. Lots of great restaurants. The only negative is its a challenge to get around from this area by public transit. We had to take a taxi to most places. Luckily they are not too expensive. Otherwise great place to stay

relax in the sun. Dont miss this great place for relaxing and doing nothing much but wondering about (Romantically or family) Spend a couple of hours walking around the port looking at the artwork, and architecture of the buildings. The port is big, so never really gets crowdedThere are hundreds of cafes and bars, all facing the docks. Dont miss the floating museum especially if you have got kids. Then cross over to the nature reserve and spend a couple of hours there too.

Love this neighborhood . At Puerto madero you can see the modern in contrast with the old and I loved it. Great experience to walk along the boardwalk and pic a place to have a drink. Think next time in BA I will be staying around.

Nice to be there. Very nice place. With a variety of good restaurants, but some of them are very expensive like Cabaña Las Lilas, other are cheaper but not so good like Mirasol. But the place has many options

Excelent for walking, drinking and eating. Puerto Madero has a lot of amazing places. You can drink and eat, and walk along the river. It's perfect in the day and in the night.If you visit B.A., you must visit Puerto Madero!!!

Beautiful view!. Puerto Madero is the right place to enjoy a good view and have a coffee or whatever else you want. I stayed in Buenos Aires for 12 days and went there every time i could. The streets nearby could be desert at night but not dangerous. Anyways, go there during the daylight, it is prettier than night.
Great walking and people watching w lots of restaurants. Higher end restaurant area along the river with great selections. Most restaurants offer river view tables.

Beautiful Sights. The port is a place worth visiting if your in Buenos Aires. There are a lot of nice restaurants and sights to see. One of the coolest things at the port is the Puente de la Mujer (Spanish for "Women's Bridge") is a cool rotating foot bridge. So put this on your to do list, well worth your time.
Family trip. Worth going, preferably at night, love the scene, the restaurants, a perfect walk for family or couples.

Nice view, weird and unfriendly people . It has a very nice view, even though it's a little bit dirty (water and surroundings). Walking at night might be a little bit dangerous (we were once spit by a group of teens that wanted some spare change)
Puente de la mujer (bridge of the woman) it's a must
Beautiful. One of the most noble places of the town. A great location to take a walk and discover great restaurants! Especially beautiful at night.

Along of the river Puerto Madero . This place is the results between the old and modern city. You is going to find a extraordinary place for eating and drinking the local food and take calm break. If you don't want to spend money just you can walk along the river and watching the beatiful view sometimes Listen the local music also you can bring your own food. It is comun watching the people in the street drinking matte.

Seaport district, high-end places to shop and eat. Nice and clean district. Lots of highend places to eat and shop. Good, clean, safe area to walk. The womens bridge is a nice spot to take picture. We ate at a steakhouse called Cabana Villegas, nice area overall. Can be walked from central area of BA.

Pleasantly Surprised. Hotel concierge recommended the Puerto Madero area for a nice stroll. As it was only a mile from the hotel and the weather was beautiful we decided to go. We were most pleasantly surprised by how modern, safe, clean and attractive the area was. A great area for locals and tourists to visit. The attraction is along the River waterfront in an area that was used to unload and store cargo from vessels. The converted warehouses along the promenade have been nicely converted into restaurants and shops with apartments above. The area goes on for about a mile with a nice cobblestone walkways in areas and attractive areas along the way. Including exercise stations for joggers and benches for relaxing and watching people. They have plenty of visible police and have people picking up any litter every couple of blocks. They even have a motorized boat with a boom cleaning any litter out of the river. The whole area is really organized. It is a slight bit sterile, but still very well done.

Great walking tour and charming neighbourhood. Sort of an upscale modern neighbourhood in Bs As with a touch of history, Puerto Maero had some beautiful river front bars and restaurants as well as clean buildings and trendy restaurants. Take a few photos near the Puente de la Mujer - great photo op!

Exquisite neighbourhood. Vey charming spot to go for a stroll in the morning or during the afternoon. There are plenty of options of places to eat, drink or get an ice cream.Prices can be over the average.
Nice walking and restaurant precinct. Puerto Madero is a pleasant restaurant and family precinct which seems to attract a lot of locals. The sights and bridges make for a pleasant time.

Must Visit place in BA.. . One of memorable moments of my life as I had celebrated 2014 new year here with my Indian friends.. Fun part only 2 Indians were remaining at 5 am in the morning rest were gone and we didn't even knew.. However.. If you are in Buenos Aires on new years eve so be there.. I was there on 31 December 2013 and 1 January 2014.. Also I was there last week too on a not so special day...
Great place in BA. Beautiful, clean and amazing place in Buenos Aires. That's the modern part of capital. Worst the visit for walk and drink something.

Boqubus. Great ferry system to and from BA and Uruguay. Unfortunately Argentina rips off tourists. There is a two tier system, the locals pay much less for everything ie ferry, some restaurants, water taxis in Tigre. The taxi diver at Boquebus porto madero ripped me off for 200 pesos to Retiro, should have cost 65 pesos.Otherwise a good country and a nice European style city.

Great area. Puerto Madero area is very new and attractive. They have many new office and apartment buildings and restaurants to serve the area. We ventured to walk to La Boca. I would not recommend it, just take Uber or a taxi.

4 all tastes. You'll find a lot to do in various shops. Near the downtown is a mix of society's, from the expensive restaurants to one of the most prestigious universities (Universidad Catolica Argentina) and near the Pink House (house of Argentinian government). There's the "Floating Casino" so be ready to gamble, ice cream shops, cinemas, TGI Friday's and really close to 5 stars hotels (Hyat & Faena's hotel). Argentina is a crazy place, so when in Argentina...

Excelent food in a scenic neighborhood!!. Puerto Madero is certainly worth a visit, not only for the excelent restaurants you will find there, but also if you like to see a tango show (at the Faena Hotel for example) or just to take some nice pictures from the Puente de la Mujer or from Buque Museo Fragata Sarmiento.It is a nice place to walk around, certainly one of the safest in Buenos aires, easily accessible by a wheel chair and close to other attractions like the Casa Rosada.Known as a romantic place to be as well.

A multitude upmarket restaurants. Set in old waterfront warehouses, this area seems to be marketed as the new trendy restaurant precinct. As much as it was pleasant to sit on the balcony overlooking the water, I felt that we could have been in any major city in the world doing much the same thing. This is probably a popular place for those that live in the city, but as a tourist, I felt that it was contrived and lacked some atmosphere.
Cycle tour and a walking tour . It's a fun place to walk along and also cycle - I was part of both a walking ground and cycling tour when I visited this place
Meandering along Madero.... Fun to wander along, the views are great. Saw it in winter, would loooooove to meander along here in summer, would be super romantico!
A must visit in BA!. Great area! Lots of good restaurants and great place to just hang out. A great mix of modern and traditional architecture!
Nice clean area. Excellent selection of restaurants and walking sites. the area is a mix of modern with an amazing and iconic waterway and bridge

Better at night. This place is much better at night as you can't see how dirty the river is or the rubbish that is dropped everywhere. The buildings lack character unlike the main city. The best part is the bridge and the restored brick buildings. Stay away from the tacky new side.
Great for walks. Nice place for walks along and inside the sanctuary. The toilets in the reserve are rotten, however! There are countless food vans along the road, some of which are excellent.
Great Scenery and people watching. This is a perfect place to people-watch. Swarming with locals and tourists alike. Its vicinity to everything else makes it a good starting point.
Very special. A great combination of modern buildings on one side and old brick buildings on the other side with some old craines as a deco. Definitely worth a visit and a beautiful walk.

Nice for a stroll. Went for a morning walk before everyone else was out of bed so we had the whole place to ourselves. Found out it was designed by English architects and funnily enough I had mentioned to my friend that it reminded me of Docklands in London.Restaurants looked nice but definitely pricier than those in San Telmo where we were staying (just a five minute walk away).The bridge is definitely the highlight and the architectural masterpiece of the area.

Beautiful sunset stroll. Great place to stroll at sunset. The reflections across the building and water are remarkable and will remain pressed into my memories for many years to come. There are several cafes, shops, and restaurants along the waterway so you can stop and rest and enjoy the views. If you're in the area, it's a great walk from the shops of San Telmo as well!
Great place to wine and dine. These converted warehouses now contain up-market restaurants and is a perfect place to dine by day or night. Marine exhibits are moored as well as static naval armaments

Modern district. Quite modern and felt like a renewed district in most large cities. We ate one evening at Chila and enjoyed it, but missed some of the local flare that areas like Palermo and San Telmo had.
touristy and pricey but hip and cool. Lots of restaurant choices (most of which seem quite good) and bars and such to keep you busy at night.

Must see place. Nice place to walk and to dine. It is a must visit place in Buenos Aires. If you dont go then you have not seen Buenos Aires. Wine and meat are the specialties however if you like fish, you can have it very fresh and well cooked.

Steak and more steak. We had a beautiful 'eat as much as you like" for one reasonable price meal. Steaks, sausage, burgers and whole lumps of meat, as you would expect in Argentina. Lovely place. Starters salads and sweets. Mouth watering food. Buenos Aires people eat late so go early if you want a table without booking. Buenos Aires is a knock out city.

Love Puerto Madero. A great place to walk, dine and have fun. A must at Buenos Aires!! Beatiful at night.
The woman bridge is one of the best place to know, take pictures and learn about!
Great location. Lively buzzy area with great waterfront bars, easily accessible from city centre, historic ships to view, iconic bridge, lovely people, what's not to like?
Yawn. Well, the area seems less than chaotic, which is a plus for BA, but it seemed pretty dead when we visited.

Beatiful and relaxing visit. Beatiful area, has lots of restaurants that serve the famous "OJO" and or "Chourizo" and really a relaxing area. Take a period of your trip to visit this area and have a great meal into some of the lots of restaurant options near there.
Must see. Puerto Madero is great to hang out. There are good restaurants and bars, I highly recommend to visit.

Nice promenade along the water. This is an up-and-coming area. It's a promenade of shops and restaurants along the Rio de la Plata. There is a foot bridge called Puente de la Mujer ("women's bridge") that's a cool architectural feature. A nice way to spend the afternoon.

Enjoyable walk and scenery . We ended our day with a walk along the river. A chill was in the air but the night was beautiful. We had a few beers at a local pub and amazing seafood dinner. The walked across the Woman Bridge and saw the Anne Frank statue and as well as the cool boat.

Trendy place. We love to walk by the bank of River Plate.
The place is converted from old docks.
Catholic University of Argentina is nearby.

The modern size of BA. This place hosts the modern part of buenos Aires with the ports a few blocks away.If you like long walks along the shore of rio de la plata and looking at the view of the tall buildings, then this is the place for you.There are some trucks and street vendors along the walk but other than that is a peace one

A must-see stop while you are in Buenos Aires. I like this place especially at nightfall and later at night. Stroll the entire length from the beautifully designed "Lover's bridge" (Puente de la Mujer or Woman's Bridge but everyone calls it lover's bridge!) towards Sottovoce which is the last of a string of restaurants lining the riverfront. It is much nicer to walk on the side of the restaurants rather than the hotels. The best ambiance is on weekends when you'll see all the beautiful people walking by. There is a wide choice of lovely restaurants so don't automatically go to the most expensive Cabaña Las Lilas where wealthy tourists go, try the others.

Good for a walk along the river. . Some nice enough spots for lunch. Busy at weekends. Some good restaurants. But look out for Cabana Las Lilas. I have done a review of this place. Read if your interested.
Great Upscale Neighborhood. Old port on the river which has been converted into a nice upscale neighborhood. Great place to walk and people watch with lots of good restaurants and bars.
Great day out !. Highly reccommend a vist at Puerto Madero for chlling and relax by River Plate. The place is trendy and beautifil for a nice afternoon hang out.
Interesting part of city next to the river. There is an array of good restaurants, for lunch and dinner. Nice walkway next to river. Beautiful new neighbourhood!!
Great area to walk around. Enjoyed the area great view of modern and old walking along the canal. Bridge was amazing. Didn't have tie to eat along the banks but looked some nice places

Fantastic . Beautiful neighbourhood and great place for lunch and walks along Puerto Madero.For lunch or dinner be aware with some restaurants that charge a service table fee (does not go to waiter, it goes back to the restaurant) for example Marcelo Restaurant ($75 pesos per person)

Come see this recently revitalized area.. Puerto Madero is a bit removed from the rest of the city, but that makes it a unique destination worth seeing. The locals with offices here don't exactly love their commute, but as a tourist, it should be on your itinerary. Stroll near or around the gigantic ecological reserve, admire the modern architecture, stop by the casino, the Colección Fortabat, or just see the rest of the Paseo de la Historieta characters lurking around the area.

nice place fo honeymoon. when i have a chance to visit argentina... i went there with my hubby.. it was a business trip and a second honeymoon trip as well for us... buenos aires is a beautiful place to visit... there are so many places that could be visited... one of the most important place to be visited is a puerto madero... a port area with beauty scenery and nice place to walk around... many cafes and restaurants that could be tried for cullinary tour... anyway.. it's similar with clarke quay and boat quay area in singapore...
Our Hotel was in Puerto Madero. This is a good location overlooking the river, white walking bridge and a few blocks walk to the "Pink House" and Plaza Mayo.
A Pleasant Stroll Along the Canal. We walked along the canal here at Puerto Madero and it was a nice break from the break-neck BA hustle just a couple of blocks away.

Amazing place. The Puerto Madero is a perfect place to eat, to walk, to drink ou just to sit and apreciate the view. It's so easy to go there. And I think that is very important to know there during the day and at night.
My favorite place to live and stay. Safe and great place to live and stay. Lots of restaurants and places to visit. Good for walking, running, biking and just enjoying.

Nice stroll. Lovely neighborhood with modern architecture and next to the 3 lochs of the river and the gigantic ecological park.
Tons of restaurants on the city side of the river banks. Fabulous hotels like hotel Madero and Faena. Great for leisurely days Don't forget the bridge dedicated to the women of buenos Aires

Iconic spot to visit. Coming here based on recommendations from friends, the place was certainly cool and worth taking pictures with. I am missing what my friends tell me is a large part of the experience, in that I didn't eat at any of the restaurants, but even despite that it was a cool place to visit. One thing I disagree with though is that people say this place is better at night, but the night lighting wasn't particularly impressive.
High end hotels and restaurants in new part of town. Enjoyed the walk down the promenade near the high priced restaurants. Great views of the city and bridges. Perfect for an after dinner stroll.

How to Gentrify. When I lived in BA in the 90s, this area was just beginning to change from decrepit old brick buildings and smelly old wooden docks into "something better." Done.A delightful place to walk, sample upscale restaurants and very safe.

A renovated dockside area.. The old wharf side warehouses have been renovated into accommodation, a University Campus, shopping and restaurants. The Puerto Madero also is the ferry terminal of Buquebus. Here you depart by sea ferry to Uruguay across the Rio Plata.. The ferry trip to Uruguay is worth taking. Use a taxi to reach Puerto Madera from where ever.

New Year in Puerto Madero. I spent my new years eve there and It was great!! Probably one of the best places to go in Buenos Aires this day of the year! There is a beatiful view, nice weather, fireworks and a few partys and bars to choose for the rest of the night!

Nice area of town with good restaurants. We really enjoyed spending time near the port - there are a lot of great restaurants where you can see the water, it is a safe area where you can walk/jog freely. There are also ships that you can visit that make it nice for tourists. It is central in town and I would recommend stopping by.
Best restaurants in Buenos Aires. We loved Puerto Madero. Cabana Las Lilas is an excellent restaurant! I loved the carne asada here and desserts are just wonderful. Highly recommended!

Walking by. It's a pretty place to walk, specially at night. If you want to get dinner or something, there are great places, but not cheap...is one of the luxury places in baires...
You can get to the women bridge and take some pictures...there are great lights there!!
Enjoy
nice place to hang around. This quite new area is a place to hang around as it is quiet, a lot of restaurants and along the waterfront.

Relaxed place with perfect restaurants. Very nice spot in open area at the river.
Nice restaurants with excellent food.
It is a hot place for the more richer people to relax; beatifull buildings and well maintained pavements. Funny is that every street is named after ... A woman
modern and not authentic. Really not at all special this area of town. We kept being told how nice it was and it was just upscaled flats with not interesting architecture at all.
A good stroll . Vitiated with place with my travel buddy. Compared to many other countries, it's pretty average but worth having a stroll and do pop into the big ship when you get chance.
Worth a look. Good to look at. It's like a brand-new city across the river. How the 1% live. Not lively and not the profusion of good food one finds in BA proper.

Stylish city block. And old part of the harbor, renovated and rebuilt, with a lot of new houses, hotels, restaurants. A must-see in BA. The only thing that may be missing is a shopping mall. A highlight is the proximity to an nature reserve which is worth to walk through as well.
Much ado about nothing. After all the hype about this place we went on a walking tour which was very ordinary.There is really nothing to see.
Meh. Was expecting a lot more from something rated so highly here. A nice place to walk around sure but nothing special really.

Me encanta el puerto madero. I think puerto madero is just like another country inside of Argentina. It has lots to see and superb restaurants and things to do, even running. It is a very safe neighborhood.

Lovely city . You will enjoy this city a lot, its absolutely romantic, classy, the food is excellent the mix of spanish and Italian people created beatiful people.
The combination of the moderm buildings with old fashion eurpopean architecture makes this place original.
The city is clean and full of history and culture.
You must visit it!
The river plate area is great.

The modern are of Buenos Aires. The Puerto Madero area is close to the center of the city but the City does not feature the port. The inlet is lined on both sides with restaurants for a nice lunch or view of the water. Many joggers used the walkway for their routes. We had a great glass of wine and appetizer platter at one of the many restaurants. They all seem large with room to accommodate big groups. A popular spot for office workers to come for lunch.
Spend the afternoon here!. Modern and excellent for a walk! There are some good places to have lunch although some of them are overpriced.

Feels very European . Impressive work of urbanism, turning the old warehouses into an indeed nice and vibrant place. Lots of options for dining and partying. I do specially like the Cabana Las Lilas restaurant even though it's quite pricey range.

Interesting lunch spot . We walked around the area and observed the modern type designs of , " bridge". But the best part are the dining options. I really would only go back to visit or try a different restaurant. Although it would be a good area to exercise or walk about.

The best place to have lunch or dinner. This is a new and modern neighborhood with about 20 blocks plenty of restaurants where you can find all type of foods. the riverwalks are great to walk after eating.
Bland. Feels like any new place anywhere else in the world. High end restaurants, lots of expats. Good for an evening stroll but not unique and lacks significant local flair.

Very nice during the day and very romantic during the twilight. Buenos Aires is one of my favorite cities in Latin America and make sure you spend enough time to discover unseen and romantic part of this city. Puerto Madero is very modern area but during the night it's got it's own magnificent beauty and very romantic.
Love it!!. It is a place where you feel so relaxed it has great attractions and amazing food! It is a bit expensive so that's a bummer. But you can still go and take pictures!!

Nice area on a nice day. We walked the area and enjoyed seeing the waterside and the modern part of Buenos Aires. It was all nice and not too crowded today. We had lunch at Peugeot Lounge Cafe and it was excellent. It is one of many cafes and restaurants along the waterfront.
A good walk if you are not in a hurry. Lots of shops and up scale restaurants. Peaceful and lots of tourists, very safe. Some good restaurant didn't serve dinner after 8pm.
Nice place to visit. We enjoyed walking in the Puerto Madero. There are excellent restaurants, a nice walking area, and a beautiful Calatrava foot bridge.
"Very relaxed". We went there at the end of the weekend so it was very crowed but it was very relaxing &peace ful. There are so much to do. Very nice restaurant for lunch &dinner.
Docklands. Very similar to Canary Wharf in London. We visited the Peruvian restaurant while there and had a fantastic meal.

Watch your belongings!!. This is an interesting area created from the city's second generation port after years of neglect. It is now a trendy place with restaurants and boutique hotels. We saw a tango show at the Faena Hotel and had a wonderful evening in the area. It is also a place where pickpockets abound. Despite our world traveling, we were taken by a threesome that apparently sprayed something in the are behind us that resembled bird droppings, then appeared to help us try to 'clean up' offering a water bottle and tissues, all the while they picked our pockets and backpacks of pesos, a wallet and a cell phone. Dumb mistake on our part to have missed their intentions, as we had heard that this area could be dangerous for the very reason that this incident occurred. It put a damper on our last day here.
Adorable walk. Very pleasant walk, indeed a most go area. Not very cheap restaurants though. However, one needs to stop by for sure when in Buenos Aires.
Awesome walk . We absolutely enjoyed our walk at Puerto Madero! Beautiful walk away around the river, many restaurants and coffee shops! Great place to visit, work out or people watch!

A merger of the old port facilities with modern architectural concepts.. Modern Buenos Aires, expensive restaurants, massive cafes, architectural sights, riverfront views and a collection of cold, impersonal buildings that try to resemble residences in Lower Manhattan with a local flavor. Generally devoid of people in its neighborhoods, busy restaurants, a great place to find a good meal and to walk, if you like solitude.
Pretty neighborhood . Lovely views and the bridge is really magnificent. Go walk around during the golden hour and have a snack at any of the restaurants.
Beatifull place to relax and dine. Go on both sides, it's a nice walk, by sun set you'll enjoy the views at day light and dark. Good place for sea food

Native review. A Good place full of restaurants and nice bars by the River
It's lovely to go there on a shinny day
Walk by the riverside and taste "asado"

Excellent repurposed area. This was where the port of Buenos Aires used to be located. When the port was moved to a new location, the warehouses and storage buildings were repourposed into restaurant, shoppings and apartment and office buildings. All the streets were named after famous latinamerican women and has the also the Puente de la Mujer.

Fun, lovely, lots of options. We had a great day out with the children. Lots of ice cream shops, visited Frigate Sarmiento, eat at Siga la vaca (all you can eat bbq and drink for $350). Fantastic buildings and the Reserva Ecologica was a diamond in the rough.

Amazing place to walk around. One of the nicest place in Buenos Aires. You can go for a walk around Puerto Madero to stores or just to have a nice walk around the water. Walk to the "Puente de la Mujer" bridge to refresh your soul. Overall, a safe and beautiful area to walk with your special one or with your family.

For a nice relax walking. you can't miss Puerto Madero in your visit to Buenos Aires. Many nice choices of restaurants, cafes, bars... Beautiful walking path along the river. Very tipical place to go.. a must go.

Best place for a romantic walk for dinner. The old dock houses of Puerto Madero turned into an In-Place with a lot of good to excellent Restaurants. Walk at sundown along both sides of the ancient port with its carefully restaured steam driven Sailing ships before you choose one of the good to excellent restaurants. Depending on the weather prefer covered terrasse seating.

Nice Boardwalk Along the water. There are restaurants and a park and lots of things to see and enjoy at Puerto Madero. Check out the natural reserve and be sure to take your camera. You might capture some wildlife.

Is not a puntual place, is a neighborhood. Is the newest neighborhood of Buenos Aires, is a splendid place to take a walk, safe and quiet.- It was built over former railway yards.- As it is so new still hasn't big trees as the other districts of Buenos Aires.- You have to reach the district by one of the four bridges that cross the docks.- Is very interesting the "Colección Fortabat"
Ok. Ok for a walk around. Very modern. Seemed a bit sterile and artificial to me though. There are a few historical cartoon characters scattered about ;statues).

Nightlife and good restaurants. A great variety of different restaurants and pubs. Easy to access and walking along the waterfront. For some of the best seafood restaurants i would recommed to make a reservation, otherwise you may have to wait for a free table.

Modern, beautiful and clean district. Love this area of the city. It's so clean and quiet from the busy streets in other areas. It is a very excusive area and kept very clean. There are so many restaurants to choose from along the waterfront. Also a great place to take a run or walk. Very different than all other districts in the sense that it is quite modern. Not to be missed!

Beatiful visit. Highly recommended.. Very beautiful place to walk by the side of the river. Full of good restaurants. I can specially recommend the visit to "Fragata Sarmiento" which is and old ship which does not sail any more. It is a museum to visit. If you want to have the experience of going to mass, it is on the sencond and fourth Sundays of each month at 5 pm, It is very unusual. I have gone with foreign relatives and were very surprised. You can find it at Alicia Moreau de Justo 980, by the Woman's Bridge.

Trendy and good restaurants!. A walk around Puerto Madero is a must while you are in Buenos Aires. You'll have lots to see and to do while you're in Puerto Madero. At night the view is even more beautiful so don't forget to come back for dinner or just a walk at night. We were there in March so weather was absolutely beautiful and ideal for a night out.

Is Puerto Madero part of BA?. When you enter Puerto Madero, it seems that you are visiting a city of some other country. Perhaps USA...It is not part of BA... yet. It's different from its spirit.Besides, there is a sort of inmoral atmosphere breathed sorrounding it. The most archetipycal crooks of our recent history live -or have "operated"-there.Anyway, what is worth visitng are two emblematical ships of the Argentina Navy; la corbeta Uruguay and la fragata Sarmiento. And, I was forgetting, there is an a good number of excellent restaurants by the sides of the docks.Visit it!
The pedestrian bridge is nice and the parks are beautiful.. We walked along Puerta Madero and across the river over the pedestrian bridge. We walked the park for a bit, but didn't eat or shop.

old port turned trendy hang out. very similar vibe to Salford Quays, Albert Dock kind of place (obviously this reference is only suitable to those who've visited).Wear sensible footwear, as there are cobbles everywhere.Nice for a stroll in the sunshine, with some nice eateries lining the route.

A beautiful day. This neighbourhood is wonderful to wander around in during the day (shopping, food, the museum/art, beautiful waterfront, the installation for Queen Beatrix of the Netherlands, the Women's Bridge) and it has a busy nightlife in the evenings.You should spend a lazy day here on your trip on a sunny day.
Sophisticated. Nice place to tour and eat. You csn walk for an entire morning. Great dining área at night also. Safe to walk. A los of transporte in and out. Cool.

Very Safe and Nice. One of the few safe places to visit at BA, there's a lot of restaurant. Also there´s an ART museum, Fundación Fortabat, nice pictures. A part from that just walk and enjoy the ride. There are a couple of nice hotels. Stay there.

Old dockland. Puerto Madero used to be the area where barges unloaded goods from ships in the harbor. So, on one side of the water is an old industrial and warehouse area -- all red brick -- that was abandoned for many years until entrepreneurs converted the old buildings into chic restaurants and apartments. Across the water is a glass and steel high rise quarter used primarily for offices, but also with waterfront shops and cafes (and expensive condos). It's a very linear area, good for long walks, stretching from san Telmo in the South to Microcentro (and beyond) in the North. I have an apartment in san Telmo, so it's a pleasant area to walk in on nice days. The restaurants are all expensive, so I don't frequent them. But I can see that they would appeal to tourists. Rich business people take clients to them. The famous footbridge, puente de la mujer, is here along with two old decommissioned masted warships that serve as floating museums. Worth a tourist visit, but not really representative of Buenos Aires in general.
A place you can't miss. This place is a must, excellent for walking and it offers great options for dinner. It is very secure and view is spectacular.

Excellent choice for dinner or having a glass of wine. Puerto Madero area is beautiful even in day, but in the night it turns into something spectacular!! Old depots and modern scyscrappers are illuminated next to the river, providing the perfect scenery for a night out in Buenos Aires! Choose amongst the numerous Parillas for excellent beef steaks and enjoy a glass of wine next to the od port, it will reward your choice for sure!

Bleak when raining. There really isn't much to do even on a sunny day but don't go in the rain. No peopel to watch and not much else. They left the old cranes by the docks but they they look like industrial waste rather than photo ops.Nice restuarants.
Beautiful, relaxing. Puerto Madero is a beautiful place where you can walk, eat, enjoy the sun and the water is very relaxing and peaceful.

Great choice to walk around. Puerto Madero is an excellent choice to take a peacefull walk all around and get some time to get a drink or eat in few their multiple options of bars, restaurans, day or night. Beautifulll landscape and safe place
The newest neighborhood in baires. The newest neighborhood in buenos aires. Plenty of restaurants, bars and nightlife. During the day is a chic business place.

Lovely retreat. I really liked the atmosphere down by the Marina at Puerto Madera (the old harbour area which has been transformed over the past few years) - it feels safer than many parts of the city and whilst the bars and restaurants are more expensive than other areas it is pleasant to wander round at most times of day and night.
Excellent choice for couples. I 've been there yesterday night and I really enjoyed a romantic walk nearby the decks in the most touristic zone in Buenos Aires

A nice setting for leisure dining and shopping.. Puerto Maderos offers many restaurants and shopping opportunities in a relaxed and beautiful setting by the water. The historical area was one of the important ports of Buenos Aires (one of the reasons why Buenos Aires inhabitants are called "Porteños").If you have leisure time in your intinerary, come to Puerto Maderos. If your are really hungry, I recommend "La Bisteca" restaurant! If you are a carnivore, you'll think you have died and gone to Heaven!
Beautiful Puerto. One of my favorite Port in the world.I went there in 2014 with my friends.It was amazing.There are many restaurants there and you can enjoy the beautiful view.

Many choices for a relaxing afternoon!. I love harbor areas, having lived in Hamburg Germany; and seen what cities like London, Berlin, Paris, and others have made of harbor and old storage areas. Puerto Madero makes for a nice excursion in BA, with many choices to sit down for a coffee, snack or a meal after a walk. It was close to our office when I visited, so I snuck out in the afternoon, walked to the Puente de la Mujer, and back to one of the restaurants. Perfect afternoon! I hear that it's a happening spot in the evening, as well.

Last on the list...... Not much to see...a concrete Heiresses collection of art...have a coffee, people watch, walk over the bridge, tour an old tall ship. Does not have any real charm like the other neighbourhoods.

Richest area of Buenos Aries. I am taking a ferry to Montevideo, Uruguay out of this port....I hired a guy to give me a tour of this barrio..... the restaurants are the best.... you get a great view of the water while eating and the whole area is first class..... and it's juxtaposed next to downtown Buenos Aries and the architectural differences are amazing... Puerto Madero is pretty recent construction..... while the other side is the epitome of influences of so many different countries... Puerto Madero is a place I spent quite a bit of time in while visiting Buenos Aries... a must see and a must eat area!!!!!

Nice place for a walk expecially at late afternoon/night time. The Puerto Madero buildings have been rebuilt form old port buildings to modern restaurant/office/fitness and other locations. It is a nice place to take a walk and you will find a lot of decent and attractive restaurants to stay in.

Has lost the Charm. Over the last years this place has lost their previously charm when it was built in the late 90's. It is still a good place to walk around after a good Dinner over the some remaining Restaurants in the area but by the end of the day it's is a Tourist Spot...
Nice place and developed. Developed area and with a great alternatives of restaurants and bars.Higher price than aversge of the city but elegant environment
Good place to visit. good place to walk and browse and close to the nature reserve that divides the city from the River Plate.

its not like Buenos Aires but a fine location. The reviews say it is antiseptic and barren. it is certainly NOT like the main part of Buenos Aries but it is safe clean accessible and an easy place to visit. a wide range of competing restaurants means the standards are high and historically it is an interesting site

Remodeled Area Near to Rio de la Plata: Nice Restaurants. By Rio de la Plata, this commercial/residential area has been remodeled and become very popular. Many nice restaurants, some shopping, by marina, large Hyatt Hotel, near the presidential "Casa Rosada," and various monuments.
Lovely area. Nice area to stroll and plenty of good restaurants and bars. Easy to get to Pink House from there and St Telmo

Super!. Very nice place to be at, to share with friends. I had the best barbecue of my life at Cabaña de las lilas, I have to say carne argentina is the best of the world. I like it a lot. Ice cream is great too.

2nd best place of Buenos. Puerto Maderp is for sure one of the best place in the city to spend during evening cause is full of relöy good restourant! Nevertheless is also really good during the day to walk and run on the street! Its full of street food restourant and its pretty jung/new part of the city!

Lovely area. Puerto Madero is a really nice area of BA, some fabulous restaurants and big hotel names mean it's not the cheapest though. Still worth a walk round, don't forget to have a look round the old ship there too, it's only 5 pesos

Bubuebus to Colonia. Went to Colonia Uruguay for the day. Bought tickets on line, much cheaper and easier than standing in line on first level of the building. Walk up open counter and get boarding pass. Go upstairs through customs, very easy and fast. Nice cafeteria with coffee, pastry, snacks, and they take US $. line up early at gate if you want window seat in tourist seating, but not worth it. Fast Boat is very clean, with full service cafeteria, money exchange to get Uruguay $, and duty free shop. Terminal very clean and easy to get in and out. Cabs at rush hour double their prices. Walk west on Cordoba street couple of blocks and cabs are available at regular rates, plus you just walked faster in those couple blocks than the cab could have traveled. Did not walk around port area for shopping, etc. Better stuff outside this area.

If You Want To Pretend You Are in the U.S. Go Here. Yuck. There is not an ounce of originality or flavor to this "barrio." I am sure it unique and modern for the locals but if you are visiting go here for over priced food and tons of fellow tourists. You can see just enough if you are boarding a boat for a day trip to Uruguay (which is a much better use of your time).

nothing too special. It's supposed to be swanky part of Buenos Aires and they do have several chic restaurants and hotels but nothing special in my opinion. Good to see and check out the bridge but I wouldn't say it's a MUST see place
Fine. Nothing special.. This is fine for a walk. The area is nothing great to look at but it's nice to have an area with less cars.

still room for development. The area feels clean and new, but it was a long walk to get there and we found there was not that much to do. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes but not much else. I wouldn't recommend this on a rainy day. I wondered if we had perhaps missed something the way it gets a big mention in all the guide books. We ended up taking the hop on hop off tour bus from right next to the Hilton Hotel
Great for an evening stroll. This is a very nice place to take a relaxing stroll in the evening. There are many, many restaurants to chose from.

Great walking area. I have stayed at the Hilton in Puerto Madero, great hotel and great location. You have the river right in front of the hotel and restaurants on both sides of it. Great place for people watching and having drinks. Very nice and long walking path, you can also see and cross the Puente de la Mujer bridge or explore Fragata Sarmiento.

Great place, loved it.. We spent a Saturday afternoon in Puerto Madero, walking the boardwalk, people watching and having drinks and eating in a few of the many great restaurants and bars lining up the piers. This reclaimed port has a great artsy atmosphere and it's a very nice, safe place for tourists. We capped our day by taking an evening Gondola ride around the port, with wine in hand and great local appetizers, the evening could not have been more romantic. It is definitely a must go place when you are in Buenos Aires. We would certainly go back when we return to Buenos Aires again.
