c'mon. such a secnd rate miami beach rip off. boooooring. although for walkers and walking it is fun in good weather. there is a nice wildlife refuge trail attached to it. We liked that.
Nice part of BA. This is a nice part of BA to take a walk day or night. Its full of bars and restaurants right on the water.

A modern and trendy city with in a city. Puerto madero could be a city by its own. It's very nicely planned has great modern architecture as well as nicely refurbished 1800s port docks, wich make a nice combination surrounded by water model sculpture and nice gardens. Different insights. Puerto Madero is a new and expensive part of Buenos Aires. I walked along here several times during my stay in Buenos Aires and had different impressions. On the first of January I had an extraordinary insight: bottles and bottles where here from the party crowd of the sylvester night. Every restaurant was closed, only some other strollers where around. The light was clear and the air quiet fresh. I would not like to live in this atmosphere of Puerto Madero, but visitors should not miss the area. You can take great photos. To eat here is very costly. More Than a Stroll. There are beautiful places on earth like the side walks by the River Thames / London; Istanbul Bosphorus; Rhine / Germany; Hamburg ports; River Seine / Paris and Puerto Madero s nothing less but more to give to its visitors. The buildings and the architecture surrounding are amazing, and in such a harmony that you just walk some miles pleasantly and without getting tired and bored.The bridges, especially The Women Bridge is an interesting spot that s reflecting the artistic life style of Argantinos. You can take amazing photos around,one side s residential and offices mainly and other side s full of gourmet restaurants. Near the city center and an easy reach of plaza de Mayo as well.
Nice view. I walk along the Puerto Madero at night, with lights refletindo on the river's surface. Have many restaurants you can choose with nice ambience and good food

Modern Argentina. This area looked a bit like the Docklands in Melbourne of Darling Harbour but in minor scale.The area is relatively safe although there were some beggars around. There are some good but over priced restaurants which offer Tango shows at night and the modern "Puente de la mujer" is a great spot for photos.
Old Town Feel. We saw a tango show down on the old board walks near the cranes. These cranes are illuminated at night near the old factories. Beautiful area.
beautiful place. it nice just to be there or a while and walk around.. like city in a city... very calm and very .. modern.. its makes it very different from these od the buenos aires.. but i love it

It is certainly walkable from the main square and seeing the "women's bridge" as well as the marinas and rehabilitated warehouses in the neighborhood is fun. was cool. it was a cool area to walk about. now it looks like a little decadent, not to clean anymore, very few people, the restaurants were empty although the very nice and good day.i was here for the last on 2007 and now, 7 years late.... lots of new buildings disrupting the view, polluting the scenery.lots of beggars who goes inside the restaurants with kids and then come the security creating a situation not nice.
Great place to walk around and eat.. Wonderful restaurants a little pricey but nice area to walk around and enjoy the day and or evening.

Fascinating contrasts and cool restaurants. Lionel Messi lives in one of the high rise, glass and steel apartments down here!! Historic docks area - nicely preserved and some cool restaurant s where the locals come to to eat, so must be good!

Great Restaurants and safe to jog in the morning.. It is not an historical place for Europeans. Re-Designed and executed 3 times in the last three century. In any case must to see. You may find a lot of info at wikipedia.

New Years Eve. What a lovely place to spend New Years Eve. Dinner and fireworks over the water. Restaurants all charge a steep price fixed menu, as would be expected in any city on this night. Check prices--some include entertainment and are even more expensive, which seems superfluous given the fireworks show outside. I suggest reserving an outside table at whatever restaurant you choose. Taxis can be hard to get at the end of the night but not impossible. We could have arranged a taxi in advance for $400 pesos, but decided to take our chances and we were able to hail a taxi for $300 sometime before 1:00am.
very nice neighborhood. we went to see the street of El Caminito that you hear in a tango and bought many presents to bring to our friends.

Be ready to dig deep in your wallet for dinner here!. Puerto Madero is a lovely renovated port area with trendy lofts, new restaurants, and some attractions like tango shows. It's a must-see in Buenos Aires but it's very expensive to eat in this area, so the budget traveler might just pass through without eating here. It's close to Plaza de Mayo so check it out while you're in that area.

Beautiful waterfront at night. Well-maintained and quaint board walk along the water restaurants and bars to stop out. It's relatively easy to get a taxi as well but make sure it's on the water side of the street and not the opposite side of the street when you hail a taxi.
Lovely place. It's the perfect place to spend your evenings sitting at a restaurant, eating good food and drinking a good wine. Lots of good restaurants. Very pleasant.

A REFURBISHED OLD CITY PORT!. By the very end of the 19th Century and very early stages of the 20th Century, the main entrance and exit ways to and from Argentina was its Buenos Aires city port. Here not only passenger and general cargo ships were handled but also huge grains carrying ships that used to be filled up with different types of grains to be mainly carried to European consuming countries. Docks had their managing and handling buildings built right at their side, so today these buildings stand facing "Moreau de Justo Ave." that runs close and parallel to the water side. It is an excellent area for a stroll or even for an early morning run as downtown with its hotels is just a few blocks away. Most if not all the former docks and port servicing buildings have been refurbished, now housing offices while on street level a few bars, different good restaurants and coffee shops can be found. During older port operating times, grains carrying ships would arrive empty, so in order not to sit too high and roll on the seas, ballast was added in the form of bricks. These were then unloaded and mostly used to build the mentioned servicing buildings as also others around the country. Grains were loaded replacing the dead ballast. Years back a thorough refurbishing of all the old port was undertaken, so the old buildings again showed the red bricks' walls in all their splendor, with the Catholic University being the most outstanding ones. At the docks, a couple of historical Frigates can be seen and visited too. Finally, the huge cranes used to move loads on the ships were brought back into their original shape and appearance, thus marking another reminiscense of the ports former activity. Sergio Corbet.

Spectacular area!. Most of the buildings in this neighborhood are either extremely expensive condos or multinational corporations, but it is incredibly safe, a great place to run/walk/rollerskate/bike, and has great bars and restaurants! We spent an evening sailing from the Yacht Club and came back and had a delicious meal along the pier. Taxis are cheap to get to the other parts of town, but are a little harder to come by unless you wait outside one of the big hotels. Highly recommended for when you want a nice place to sit back and relax and enjoy a drink or two with a nice view.

Beautiful. Beautiful place to visit. If you like us and enjoy long walks, this is place to be. An old harbor that was restored and converted to restaurants, shopping (that I do not care) places to visit, flagships that can be explored. It is kind of expensive, but what da heck, if you are on vacation.

Nice area but way too expensive. The area itself would get 4 points. It's a nice place to hang out and to go for a walk. It has a OK skyline (I've seen better though). BUT it is VERY expensive. As average-budget-backpacker we did not even dare to drink a coke there.

One of the nicest place in town. Nowadays, the newest side of this neighborhood is nicer than the oldest with the old red buildings. Puente de la mujer is very very nice. Visit in the afternoon and have a drink in one of the terraces.

Bring your roller skates!!. It's my second trip to BuenosAires and the first time I came I tought I should have brought my roller skates, we'll this time I did and it's been awesome to roller skate with my two twin daughters in puerto madero, have have been having such amazing days. At night gets a little crowded but nothing really bad, if you prefer you can go in the morning and it will be almost empty.

Best steak found here.. Not a worthwhile sight since it is modern and not very historic like the rest of the city.However, there are some good restaurants here, and we had the best steak during our whole trip at Cabaña Las Lilas.
Nice, but expensive.. I spent the new year's eve in that place. It was nice, fireworks and so many people. But the restaurants over there are too expensive.

Interesting Area with Great Restaurants. This is an interesting area of Buenos Aires with a variety of great restaurants from which to choose. The neighborhood also has a reputation for being safe, so visitors can stroll along the boardwalk between the business locations and the piers without problems. Very popular.
Nice area. Great place for a walk, there are many restaurants to choose from and it's also safe to walk around (even at night) and check out the area, worth a visit!

Nice area! Dont miss it!. One of the most beautiful area from Buenos Aires,different from the entire town.Many restaurants,coffee shopps,nice place to walk or to run (if you are a dynamic person).The Mujer bridge is the main simbol of the port.All the neighborhood is clean,with modern buildings and nice people.Go there in the afternoon to enjoy the view and to have the dinner there!

Needs more shopping. It is a nice area they cleaned up but really not enough shopping. It is all restaurants which is fine but only in the evening when it was hopping. daytime it was people eating lunch and others meandering a round trying to find something to do. I think people go there thinking there is a lot going on ( sort of like the seaport in NYC) but really it was boring during the day.

a fine example of water front redevelopment. A nice area to walk around and spent the afternoon / evening with food and drinks. One of the few places in BA worth visiting in terms of urban planning & architecture.

A scene you have seen in dozens of cities. Stop me if you've heard this one.Old warehouses. Run down. Dirty. Forgotten.Hip artsy types move in. Restaurants open. Cool fonts are used. Dining is plein air. Small lights are strung. Potted plants added. People stroll. Rents rise. Repeat.It is very pleasant, but it really does feel like anywhere. I would have rated it "Good" but TA does not have "Good" and "Average" is too tepid.
Nice walks and views!. A very nice place filled with very good restaurants and nice walks by the river. A must if you visit the city of Buenos Aires!

Beautiful walk and great restaurant options. This is a great place for a stroll. Take it easy and grab good food. The bridge is pretty as well. The Puente de la Mujer was designed to mimick a couple dancing the tango.

Nice View, nice restaurants. Puerto Madero is an excellent tourist attraction. You have a bunch of restaurants alongside the port and food there is delicious and expensive. You can take a 10 min walk and get to the other side going throught the Woman's bridge, you'll see a number of modern buildings and right behind them is a park, passing this one you'll find some sort of eat street, Its main specialty are Hot Dogs, Paninis and burguers, which is perfect is you are low bugeted and restaurants by the port are unthinkable for a meal.

Attractive area, good restaurants. This area was rebuilt several years ago and now is one of the desirable areas of the city. It houses office buildings, hotels, restaurants, a marina, a famous bridge, and two floating museums. From the perspective of a tourist, however, it is of more limited interest than other areas of the city. There are two floating museums worth visiting, the ARA Uruguay, a corvette originally commissioned in 1874, and the ARA Presidente Sarmiento, a training tall ship. Both have very nominal admission charges and are nice exhibits for those interested in ships. There are also some good, but expensive restaurants.
Not much to see. The Calatrava bridge is not interesting, a nice boardwalk in the evening, but not more. We were at a very good but expensive parrilla restuarant there.
Upscale, modern area.. We stayed at the Hilton there. Great for watching New Year's Eve fireworks. Lots of restaurants and a nearby park. Convenient to much of the city. Right on the river.

Beautiful area to take a walk.. We were here for the fireworks on New Year's Eve. Our restaurant ( Cabana Villegas) was amazing and the evening was great.Safe, beautiful and a great place to watch the sunset

Great Place But Expensive for more travelers budget. Let me explain my Title "Great Place But Expensive for more travelers budget" i said that because really is expensive for more travelers ,the customer service ,cleanness,ambient,and the food is great Argentina Made not doubt about , if you willing to expend some decent money is ok but is your budge is a litter tight don't be afraid to visit other places like Siga La vaca close too and you get a buffet for 10 box all inclusive include a bottle of house wine ........just try and share your experience
Beautiful to go around for a night stroll. A very nice area to walk around. There are very many nice scenic views nearby for a two hour walk both during the day and night.
Walking Tour. The sky scrapers, the wide parks -- this was gorgeous. And we had our best meal here. If only I could remember the name of the restaurant!

Clean and felt safe. My wife and I spent 2 hours walking right around the old docks, stopping for good coffee on the way. Many up market restaurants available, but looked pricey. Felt safe and enjoyed the time.
Nice restaurants and good ambience. The sail boats look really cool. There are plenty of selections for the restaurants. The walk along the port is very nice.

Nice place to walk along the water front. We went here on a Sunday morning, trying to escape the hustle and bustle of BA. There were a few others doing the same but by mid-day the vendors showed up and the place really came alive. There were no walking paths through the Ecological Park but a great walkway that bordered the park. This will probably become a Sunday morning tradition for us.

Visit the old Sailing ships. Good place for a walk about away from the downtown madness. Nice restaurants and places to stop for a drink. There are a couple of old sailing ships open to the public. I think the admission was less than $1.00 and was a most interesting stop.

Modern and chic. When in Buenos Aires Puerto Madero consists a welcoming different "break" from the more typical porteno quarters. Just go for a stroll and have lunch at one of the interesting restaurants close by the river. Of course, some might find the colour of the river water less appealing, but it's a part of what makes this place unique.
Trendy. Lot's of restaurants to choose from with price ranges from average to very high. Very trendy neighbourhood, great night out.

Stroll and eay. This is one of BA's newer parts of town. It's very clean and safe and has nice views of the water. Not much else to do but walk the boardwalk or eat at restaurants (which include a TGI Fridays...blegh). Good parillas here tho!

a little disappointed in Cabaña las Lilas. The service was fine but the steaks were not as good as was expected, given its reputation. Quite pricey. We like some of the other restaurants better and it is a very attractive spot to visit and walk around by the water.

Feels like you walked out of Buenos Aires and into another country. Great places to eat with a nice view and walkable location. No need to spend a lot of time there, not much shopping or other attractions. Surprised there wasn't an ice cream shop?
Nice and safe place to visit. The restaurants and coffee shops in the area ,the transformation of the old port docks to an amazing residencial and commercial area, safe from any possible offenders .

Wow, a quiet spot in Buenos Aires!. That's right, if you're looking to get away from the hustle and bustle - head on over to Puerto Madero - great restaurants and a lovely cycle or walk around the eco-logical reserve. And, here's an interesting fact - the plant and tree life are all naturally grown - not one thing was planted. The nutrients from the concrete and excess building materials that were thrown into the river helped mother nature grow!

Best when doubling as a meal stop. Puerto ModeroIf you’re on a short visit to BsAs skip this one. Eat some beef, go to Cafeteria Ideal and learn a little tango. This is a second level attraction. But visit this area at meal time and let it do double duty. The area is worth a visit only if you’ve been in town for a while and are seeking a diversion. Most interesting: The commercial urban architecture of the last century, the old cranes left over from the port days, the 19th century sailing ship, the Fragata Sarmiento, moored in the second pool and open for tours. Seaward of the pools and the new hi-rise development over looking them, is an immense botanical reserve. Puerto Modero is a big place. The four basins built to increase port capacity in 1890s, but were quickly out-dated. This area has been urban renewed. The gorgeous brick warehouses lining the pools have been remodeled into trendy apartments and port-side restaurants.
Nice clean area of town. There are plenty of good restaurants and bars here, a bit on the expensive side though. The national park in the area is also worth a visit
Excellent. Beautiful place, great places to eat and enjoy a nice evening out! Great place for couples and families.

A must. Lots of places to eat or have a drink, nice breeze in the summer, the color of the river is not the most appealing but the strolling along it is. It feels safe to walk aroound and there are many restaurants to choose from.
Sterile but nice in a while. Its a sterile place, but you should still go nevertheless.Its a very pleasant walk, which reminds you of docklands, darling harbour or singapore.

Nice area to walk. Nice area to stroll. Many restaurants (relatively expensive). You can take ferries from the port to Colonia in Uruguay (see reviews and forums for tips). Tip: If you're taking a boat trip and coming back exiting the port building, avoid the taxis at the port that offer to charge a fixed fee to your destination. If they don't turn on their meters, get out.

Very nice!!!!. In my opinion iso one of the best places of the city. The area was completely degraded, and went thru a big recovery in the 90's. All the neighborhood is beuatiful, very very safe (that's one thing to consider in Buenos Aires, all Latin America, in fact… trust me I live in Brasil). There are some hotels in the area, and several restaurants, some amazing, others not so much! I reccomend going by the end of the day, walking around, having dinner and take another walk to enjoy the night views!!!!

Good view with nice restaurants. We just walked around this area to relax and to have dinner. There are many very good restaurants and cafes in this place. If you prefer, you can take a rest and appreciate the view.

great area for a stroll. What a lovely area, to have a walk around , and to be out of the hustle and bustle of the town, that lies right next to it.The port and the old ware houses create a cosy and historically interesting area, the restaurants are varied, and have terraces towards the water, the contrast of the old and the new is fascinating to see, a must go
Great restaurants. For high class dining Puerto Madero has many choices in a very nice location. You can find every type of menu. Hard to go wrong.

Ecology reserve. If you like beautiful green spaces in large vibrant cities, the reserva ecologica is a must see in an area recently recovered (with major new investment in the old port around it) from years of neglect.

Nice restaurants. We walked the area also to visit the Dutch embassy (because I was robbed of my backpack with all my valuables. I was stupid enough not to leave my valuables in the safe provided in the room of our hotel). Beware of scams in Buenos Aires! We had a nice lunch with Dutch friends in one of the restaurants in Puerto Madero. There are two "floating" museums in this area that we however did not visit.

Lights on the water. We dined at Le Grille, which was excellant. They had a mate souffle that is to die for. THe location right on the canal at the beautiful white soaring bridge, even on a rainy evening, with the mist rising was magical. Puerto Madero itself is an elegant change from Palermo Soho where we had been staying-- both very different and both lovely.

Lots of neat restaurants. Lots of great restaurants and nice area to walk by the docks people rollerblading walking with their animals little park areas to sit in the sun can visit the sailing ship museums by the docks

Great area for a stroll. Great area for a walk. Take time to the Reserva Natural and enjoy the local flora and fauna. After that have dinner in one of the many restaurants in the area, and finish with some local icecream
Beautiful if you want to go for a walk!. Nothing better than walking besides the river in the sun, also full of good restaurants, and the Puente de la Mujer is also beautiful.
Surprising. So surprising. Such a lovely renovated dockspace. A relaxing and modern part so close to the centre. The architecture is quite nice and some lovely looking restaurants and buildings

a nice place to walk or run but not to have diner. I've to say: the local government did it's best to make something of this former dock-area. Indeed, the old houses, the machinery, all the panorama of the former harbour is present, on the whole clean and it's the perfect match for a long walk or run on a sunny Sunday. But: do not eat there. It's probably the most expensive area to eat and be disappointed about the quality of service and food. I've tried nearly all of the coffee-places and restaurants and I wonder why a costumer would go for a second time. All, I repeat All of them, are outrageous expensive and under the level of aceptable in terms of quality.

The New Buenos Aires near the port. Puerto Madero is a new builded area where was located the main argentine port years ago .The architects took benefit of old constructions and builded nice offices and restaurants near the water .You can find there tourists and office workers during the week .If you walk around a mile in east direction you can arrive to the Natural Reserve , a green territory gained to the Rio de la Plata .Also there are a lot of new buildings where rich people live , and also you can find offices and 5 stars hotels .

A WONDERFUL GET AWAY. This is truly a walking pleasure with Hotels, Shops and Restaurants in trendy renovated buildings. The waterfront is scenic and safe with joggers even at night. Good police presence and a feeling of security, modernity and beauty pervade the area. Beautiful views of the BA skyline, especially at night. As you stroll you can catch the wafting aromas from a dozen different types of cuisine. A great place to take your family.

Walk, Walk, and Walk Some More. Lots of interesting sightlines of the city. Much better than most dock-conversion neighborhoods I've visited. Don't forgot to walk through La Faina Hotel. Think of Alice in Wonderland with lots of Red Velvet . You will know what I mean when you see it.

Great place in Buenos Aires, but with difficult access. Puerto Madero is a beutiful and peaceful place of the city, particularly on weekends. Nice restaurants, nice places to walk. The problem is the access. You have to cross through not at safe places. But once you arrived, is the safest places in the city.

Nice place. Great place
Without doubt, seems more of an international city of the 1st world
than a latin american capital
After visiting several cities and latin america capitals
Great restaurants, nice place to walk
And to enjoy. Close to many attractions
Amazing view!. Unforgettable place to stay, walk, run & visit. You must be at Faena Hotel & Faena Arts Center, and eat at Red at Madero Hotel.

Take a break from chaotic traffic. Puerto Madero is close to chaotic area, downtown Buenos Aires, Gov't house, Metropolitan Cathedral, and, once you're there, you immediately relax. There are fine restaurants,some more expensive than others, you may eat next to the boats and enjoy the view. There are interesting differrent architecture styles, old buildings recycled. If you're keen on arts, you MUST visit the Fortabat Collection where you'll be able to appreciate true Argentine art: the most famous and outstanding painters, sculptors, artists exhibitions take place there. If you're a bird watcher and nature lover, you should visit the Reserva Ecológica: you can walk along the easy walking trails next to the De La Plata River.
Great place for eating and sight seeing. I went there twice wen I visited Buenos Aires the place has tons of restaurants and has a nice view of all the boats and yacht that are there

Many restaurants. Great for walking and eating ! Easy to get to from any part of BA. Massive investment by authorities on Hilton hotel bang in middle. If you like steak there are many good restaurants in the area.

Puerto Madero walking at night. Puerto Madero is located just across from the main train station of Buenos Aires. The area consists of lots of restaurants, canals, shops and bridges. It was very lovely at night when we visited in Mid November of 2014. There is a very nice bridge in the center, beautifully lit and lots of young girls where there nicely dressed with their families celebrating their 15th birthday - as we were told a local tradition.Highly recommended.
Great place for lunch. Liked the environment, the large number of quality restaurants to choose from and the view. Easy walk from the city and the port. Great atmosphere.
Nice clean modern part of town. Beautiful, clean, new part of town. Modern architecture. Nice restaurants, a little pricy. We just drove around.
Great area. Great place to relax and take in the views, to have a great dinner or a nice glass of wine. Several great restaurants to choose from
Nice walk. Very interesting and pleasant area. Close to downtown and at the same time relaxing. There are lots of restaurants if one chooses to take a break.

Clean and safe. It's a very beautiful place but not very unique after the bridge. One side it's great to walk, enjoy the view, go for a lunch or coffee. The other is quite cool to walk around but it's very quiet and empty. A nice contrast between what a standard city looks like compared to the vibrant and charming San Telmo.

Very new, well equipped. The area is so close to the City Centre you would be amazed, with good riverside restaurants of varying levels, reasonable choice and generally laid back feel. Nice to walk around and a contrast to the classical architecture of the town itself.

Clean near and safe. Walk, stop...eat....drink...very safe. We ate at Sorrento and it was five star. We've traveled to Sorrento and we had the tenderloin, with Bernadine, e course special. Started with my husband the prosciutto with Formaggio and tomatoes and olives. I had the gambas al ojillos. My babies were better. We finished with the tiramisu! Better than in italia. Y yo sono la Italiana:)

The old harbor as the heart of a modern development. A unique project to secure old warehouses by giving them new destinations. They now accommodate offices and on the ground floor restaurants and terraces.The beating heart of nightlife. Across the water all kind of new buildings with apartments, offices and restaurants. Both sides connected by a beautiful bridge from Calatrafa and the water as harbor for antique sailing ships.Old harbor cranes as frozen memories of other times.A very special place is the sculpture the former Dutch Queen Beatrix donated.
The bridge. Pleasant area of Buenos Aires whose main attraction is the Puente de la Mujer by Calatrava. Those interested in modern architecture should definitely go there.

Impressive. This was by far the most interesting and attractive barrio of BA that we saw. The old docks cleaned up, one very dramatic bridge, all the old warehouses converted into very stylish, very expensive restaurants, cobbled walks by the docks and a magnificent grouping of skyscrapers.

Battery Park City Twist. Great surroundings i.e.; waterside, architecture and restaurants.Variety of many fine dining restaurants. Short walk from Cathedral Station of Subte "D". Can combine in one day Cinco de Mayo Square, Financial District, Avenida de Florida (shopping) and Buzuebus Station for Ferries to Uruguay.Many restaurants do have Lunch Promotion effective 12:00PM every day. Highly recommend Puerto Madero neighborhood for the day.
Great area. Had a gorgeous dinner at the grille . Watched all the runners and walkers out for a warm spring stroll

too expensive even for foreigners. good atmosphere with good restaurants served in a very argentinian style, but to be honest, expensive even if compared with Paris or London, you have to be very careful in ordering

Beggars around. thr place has top quality housing and hotels. But walking along sidewalks, especially sidewalks not adjacent to main streets, and especially sidewalks adjacent to the water, I'd almost impossible due to the amount of beggars around, of all ages. Mind your belongings. Do not show electronics. Sunbathe and chat in a low voice.
Adorable. This is such a great place to spend time with your friends! Great views and amazing restaurants! If you want to take some incredible pictures, I would recommend going here for sure!

Good food & frendly people. This was a big surprise to see this nice place that were hidden near Buenos Aires downtown
But be aware that not all restorants have a good food, specilly when they charge $25 peso for each person
Look up in Yelp

Sofisticates neighbourhood in town. Old buildings plus ultra premium residences ... and lot of restaurants. Puerto madero is the youngest neighbourhood in Buenos Aires, built around the old port. The entrerteinment offer is impressive, A bit fancy and overprized but you can find some jewels there.Walking along the docks by the water is beautifull, mostly in spring and autumm. You can visit 'El Puente de la Mujer' and the 'Corbeta Sarmiento (boat museum)', you also have there the 'Fortabat Museum' (great)'.You can also go to the inner borough and visit the old 'Costanera Sur' with beautiful art, statues, buildings, etc ... or have dinner at the 'Faena Hotel' (any way you have plenty of restaurants and drinks offers). 'La fuente de las Nereidas' is an extraordinary piece of art, and you can walk all along by parks and public show places.Get a morning, evening or a whole day and go there

Nice area to wander around. A pleasant walk on the old docks. They have been renovated to provide a nice walk. Nice bars and restaurants. They have left the old cranes in place to add to the feel of the place. Felt safe to walk around.
Hanging out at the port. Truly lovely area, great for a cup of coffee outside and something surely smothered in dulce de leche. Beautiful walk, cute shops, a must venture from downtown.

Nice restaurant district and generally nice part of Buenos Aires!. Nice restaurant district and generally nice part of Buenos Aires! It was really nice to walk around while on a trip to South America in 2009 ... I also really liked the steakhouse that we went to as well as the Choripan I ate from one of the many riverside street stands.Cool experience!

Port of Buenos Aires. It used to be the port of Buenos Aires, but has been renovated and is full of modern building now. Nice promenade and many good restaurants to chose from. There is an old navy training ship moored there that can be visited.

Restaurants and night life galore. For dinner dancing and tango PM is the place to be. Also a great place to stroll on a lazy afternoon. If you want a change of pace grab your passport and take a ferry to several ports in Uruguay.

A different Buenos Aires. This is the new Buenos Aires. Built in the last 20 years on the old harbour, Puerto Madero feels like any modern city. You could be in Toronto, or Dallas. Modern buildings, wide streets, few people on the streets. Aparently it gets really crowded at night. It does not have the old charm of Buenos Aires but it has nice architecture and it is a very pleasant and safe place to spend a sunny afternoon. Lots of restaurants and coffee shops.I recommend it. It is a big contrast to Bs As, not nicer in my opinion, but worth seeing it.

Nice place to walk or dine!. BA has done a nice job of developing the waterfront and making a nice area for people to walk and enjoy a beautiful day, or visit one of the many restaurants that line the walk. Very scenic from the water to the sailboats. Even the trees were blooming, which added some nice color. The sides of the walkwy are nice and straight with no obstacles. There are places at the end and one bridge in the middle where you can cross. You can basicaly walk around it all day if you want good excersize and to watch people. Very safe, I have been there during the day and at night. Definitely worth a visit if you are in Buenos Aires.
Siga La Vaca. Parrilla restaurant in Puerto Madero. It was waiting room only which signifies the popularity. Excellent salad bar. The meat was not unusual but good.

Nice strolling, lots of restaurants, not much else. I had an afternoon to spare and since this was highly rated, a d near the ferry terminal, I decided to go there. I really wanted to do shopping and though it would be a place for that, but turns out it is really a nice restaurant row, with a variety of restaurants, all with open air areas with a view of the port.

The calm and quiet of Buenos Aires. Puerto Madero is a wonderful area in which to walk, stop to watch the sea birds, have an adult beverage, and just unwind from a hard day of sightseeing. It is beautiful with lots to look at.
Loved it!. Puerto Madero is a great place to go for a walk on a chilly day! The view there is a great so make sure you take your camera!
Nice walk. Great for walking in a sunny day, have a cofee and relax. Some restaurants are overpriced, some have great food and service. Take a minute to study the menus and the prices.
Elegant and yuppie. Nice restaurants, good food, a bit more expensive than elswhere in BsAs. but lacking atmosphere especially during daytime
Modern revamp of an old port area. Nice for a walk in the fresher air of the old port area, cafes and restaurants are a bit more expensive than elsewhere in the city but good enough.
Nice place. Its a really nice place. You can walk around,have an ice meal near the river . The safe place in buenos aires. Different from the

Best place in town. This is the best place in Buenos Aires, whether it be for just stroll or coffee, lunch or dinner. Granted, it is also one of the most expensive, but it´s really worth the extra pesos. It´s a wonderful and pictoresque marina, with an ocean breeze that keep coming in. You can sit and admire the view or you can cover the full extent of Puerto Madero which may take you an hour or two. After this long walk, stop by at any cafe looking to the bay or if it´s late enough, just sit back and order dinner. And to top it all, it´s by a landslide, the safest place in town! Don´t miss Puerto Madero when you visit Buenos Aires!
Excellent place, one of the best in Buenos Aires.. Good shops, hotels and restaurants.Nice to walk and enjoy.Beautiful views, one of the best places in Buenos Aires.
Home. Best trend setting place in the city! Puerto Madero has many restaurants, all types, Italian, Argentine, Spanish, Mexican, Sushi, Seafood, etc.

Beautiful walking areas. This is a bit out of the way from the city, but it is nice to get off the beaten path. The water is quite brown, but the sidewalk cafes and shops are lovely. There is great space for walking/running etc and some lovely bridges and architecture. Great outdoor restaurants too. Definitely worth a few hours.

Newer modern upscale section of Buenos Aries. As you walk around, you'll see streets that pay homage to outstanding women in Argentine history, including the interesting Woman's Bridge that you can walk across, Among the expensive(but not too overly) restaurants/stores in this high rent district, the bridge is free! Included in this urban development of old docks we toured a ship that was free, until you exit, when a donation is expected. A great/safe area for walking, but it will be windy. Will return at night, as I'm sure it's more crowded & beautiful There must be a great view of the city lit-up. The area is larger than expected with a number of 30-40 story buildings. Even though many port cities have new re-development, I'm not sure the others are as large & spread out as this.

Lively bars & restaurant area in BsAs. This is our second time in Bs As & both times we have found Puerto Madero a great place to walk around in the evening & select a bar or a restaurant to while away an evening.
Nothing Special. The pride of Buenos Aires is just a walkway along a canal lined up with empty restaurants. Nothing really worth seeing

Very nice and modern area. The place is covered with chick and modern restaurants. Great place for a stroll, watch the river or have dinner. Restaurants were great, fancy, pretty formal, but inexpensive.

An oasis. Nice retreat from the bustling streets of BA. Its the newer, more modern side of town. Go for a walk along the water. There's some nice restaurants there. For something a bit cheaper, head toward the ecological reserve - there's a bunch of mobile food stalls serving chorizo and beef burgers.
My Most Beloved Place In Buenos Aires. I have loved this venue for years. It is like a new town right on the river. It is full of class hotels, corporate headquarters and some great restaurants.

Fun to Check Out. Been to BA many times and Puerto Madero is different than the rest of BA. Very modern and almost feels like you are in a US city somewhere. I wish it had more shops, but on a sunny day, its fun to walk around, check out the restaurants, and to check out the Fragata Sarmiento, which was actually very good and very cheap! Puerto Madero is must when in BA, so you can see how the modern part of BA is expanding and growing. Not at the top of the list, but worth checking out. Also walk across the Puente de la Mujer bridge. A very neat looking bridge. Might as well bring a lock as well with your name on it. Looks as if people are starting the same "love locks" tradition as they do in Paris. Enjoy!
very nice place along the water full of nice restaurants. We spent just a little time walking along the river and ate at a great restaurant Cabanas las Lilas.

Very touristy, nothing special. Last night was a beautiful evening, so I decided to follow the advice of fellow spanish students and go for a stroll in/around Puerto Madero. Bottom line -- nothing special. Having spent the last 3 months in Bs As, I found PM to be these least authentic spot so far. It reminded me of so many waterside US tourist attractions -- South Street Seaport comes to mind. If that's your desire, enjoy! If not, spend your time some where else.
Nice area. Restaurants all around with nice food, excellent sight seeing. Sidewalks large and nice with lots of tourists and local walking around. Beautiful skyline
great place with a lot of restaurantes. great place with a lot of restaurantes and very nice to walk and pass cople of hours. I really enjoy it to have lunch and dinner, the offer is big.
Like most other ports. It was ok, but I must say seeing it arriving via boat is quite nice. Driving in would probably be anti-climactic.
very interesting place. shopping and eating area built on the old area of the docks./ / public transport a little bit difficult to reach thereGood restaurants

great place to have meal , various choices ,. tried 3 different ones , food was good , service was ok in general . italian one was very good service , all tips must be cash , and have expensive " couverts" fees , at teh price we pay should not be

Great place to walk and eat. Don't miss out on visiting Puerto madero even if it is for a late evening to eat out at a local restaurant. You get a great view of the river and see some of the more modern part of Buenos Aires in the background of Puerto Madero.

Nothing new, expensive, same as any other modernised dockland area. Well, what can I say really ? There are so many similar places in all cities with old regenerated dockland areas. I've visited so many of them in Germany, Britain, US, Spain. So, you know what to expect. Attracts people with new money, tourists, expensive restaurants and their customers. It's a good walk along the water and plenty of expensive above-average restaurants to sample, nothing more.
To walk and enjoy. Puerto Madero is a newest part of the city. Have a lot of green areas, hotels and wondeful places to eat delicius argentinian food. Highly recomended!

A nice promenade along the river. We went there twice, once to dine with friends at Campagna Las Lilas and once by ourselves to have the buffet in another place nearby. We enjoyed walking up and down the promenade, taking pictures, and contemplating restaurants. There is no comparison between Las Lilas and the buffet so if you only have one day there, just go to Las Lilas but I am warning you, it is very expensive! The service is great and the food is good!

Excellent day and night. Trendy neighbourhood in Buenos Aires. Excellent for enjoying river views and watching the locals as they jog or have a stroll around. Full of restaurants on the boardwalk with scenic views and late night dining. For convenient prices and tasty Italian food try La Parolaccia.
Great place!. It is a cool place to eat out, have a drink and meet both locals and tourist.. Cool idea to bring back the old cranes as a decor! :)

Lovely walk & restaurants. Puerto madero makes a lovely walk both in day and nighttime. It's absolutely safe and full of mostly locals and some tourists. The restaurants are generally good, there's a lot of choice. There are some cranes left over here and there, it makes the area more interesting and different.

A great place for an awesome meal!. You can stroll among Puerto Madero restaurants. There is plenty of places for people to choose. Most of them have outdoor seating with beautiful views. On Sunday it is a good place to walk and enjoy your time.
Must see area of B A. . It is the "in" place in BA. Converted area that hasBars and restaurants. It's near the river and plenty to see. Good tourist area.

Excellent place for strolling, eating, people-watching. Beautiful place! Clean and modern, places to eat and shop. We spent the better part of a morning enjoying ourselves. The couple we were with had been there at night and said it is absolutely beautiful all lit up. A must-see if you are in Buenos Aires.
All new. Since my last visit to BA Puerto Madero has grown and so lovely. Lots of interesting things to see and great places to eat.

Nice place to visit in Buenos Aires; be careful about pesos !. There are very nice places in Buenos Aires including Puerto Madero; rich and elegant part of the city. Just have your pesos ready before going Argentina; because most of the hotels do not exchange dollars to pesos and even if they to they give a very low rate like banks almost half of the rate they offer in exchange offices. But to find an exchange office is really difficult; often unmarked but you can find one by asking around.

River view. Full of nice restaurants, tourists from everywhere surrounded by the newest buildings in the city.
Nice view from the river!

Lovely area for a walk. A great area where they have redeveloped the port & made it welcoming to just stroll around. Lots of restaurants & cafes to stop & refuel with some food & coffee. You can people watch & time just goes by as you soak in Buenos Aires! Recommend at least a few hours in this interesting neighbourhood. The anchored ships are pretty interesting as well if you're into that sort of thing.

New and Upcoming Area. Very nice and upcoming area in BA. Plenty of restaurants in the area mixed with residential and commercial development. Two great schooner ships at the dock that you could visit for a fee.

Chef doesn't follow directions.... We strolled around the boardwalk, very nice with locals & their families also out for a walk... We stopped at Puerto Cristal restaurant for an early dinner. had an excellent waiter, Javier, however, our meats were ordered medium & came out well done....who eats well done meat in Buenos Aires,,??? We were hungry so we just ate half & when the waiter came back, we stated the problem and he apologized, but offered no adjustment.

Is ne of the places to go if you visit Buenos Aires. Have a stroll along the canal, visit the corvetas (ships) anchored. The many restaurants of Puerto Madero offer a good variety of food at various price ranges; from the popular Siga la Vaca to the more sophisticated dishes of Torrento

Still Worth The Visit. Although this is not the traditional part of Buenos Aires, it offers great views from almost every angle with many restaurants nearby . You can stroll along or just spend time in this clean and modern scenery. This is a nice place for photo opportunities as well.

A good place for a walk.. This is a good place for a walk either by day or by night. The port has an interesting history as it became redundant almost as soon as it was built as the ships were too big to enter. There's an opportunity for enterprising locals to use the water more than they appear to do as a lot of the area is devoid of any boats. The restaurants are a bit pricy but it's pleasant enough on a fine day.

Nice to walk around.. but no "must see". I took the Buenos Aires Bus and hopped off at the Puerto Madero stop. It's a nice place to walk around, there are lots of restaurants all around but I must say it's not the greatest thing about Buenos Aires and if your'e in the city for a short period of time I would skip the visit to Puerto Madero.

Great for a nice walk!. For sure is a place too see in modern part of Buenos Aires. The view is really nice and it´s a great place for a evening walk. There´s a planty of chic restaurants and bars, some of them quite expensive.

Must see in Buenos Aires!. Puerto Madero is a must see. Great view, great restaurants, it deserve a day walking by the bay. You can even visit Buque Bus station and check an opportunity of visiting Uruguay for a day!
Nice walk. Went there in the evening, and place was filled with good restaurants. The view is nice, and worth a strool.

Attraction #10?????. I find it hard to believe this is rated # 10 by TripAdvisor reviewers. It has nothing of the character of the city's more established neighborhoods. It does however have a fantastic ecopark alongside the river which offers a quiet respite from the noise and traffic of .BA.

Very nice for a walk and eating . Very nice surroundings, nice old buildings that used to be of Argentinian Customs and are now home to an University and lots of restaurants and bars on the sides of a river. There is an old Navy vessel to visit, too, which might be of interest to youngsters. Some restaurants seem expensive so we ended up having a snack at the Havanna café (not that cheaper, though!) but there's also a TGI Friday's close by. The Women's Bridge is a nice architectural sight.
OVERPRICED EVERYTHING. The restaurants in Puerto Madero are average but with high prices,strictly for the tourist who wishes to miss the real Argentina and all it has to offer. Trendy.

Feeling Lucky?. Great Casino, Beautiful Waterfront and Fabulous Restaurants line the port. Please be mindful of your surroundings and enjoy some bife de lomo along with other regional cuisine and dont forget the Malbec!

Great for restaurants and just walking through. There are many restaurants along Puerto Madero deck, with a large range of prices. Most of them offers very nice and comfortable tables inside and also at the porches, with a view for the river. If you're looking for delicious meat with reasonable price, I recomend Cabaña Villegas, at 1.050 Alicia Moureau Justus Av.

Not very typical. If you know Toronto, then you will know what Harbourfton is. All newish, a lot of condos, expensive new restaurants. Generally speaking I tend to avoid it. There are some great views of the city and you can get a great meal here, at about double the price of a few blocks away at a good Microcentro restaurante, if you want to sit among a crowd of foreigners and nouveau riche locals (not that there's anything wrong with that).
Great spot to date. Good place to breath a fresh air with special company.Drink some coffee and try a dulce del leche gelato.

Beautiful!!!. Wow it's a must to visit Puerto Madero, full of the nicest restaurants in Buenos Aires. I think that The better time to go IS AT night FOR dinner, as you will see every restaurant beautifully lightend and so many people going around, in the restaurants, everywhere, you will have good time.

latest trend. Latest architectural trend in Buenos Aires. I love the ecological reserve that sits between Puerto Madero and the Rio de la Plata. Great night life, good bars and restaurants, tango shows.
To walk and to eat.... Awesome to walk around and eat and people watch! I really enjoyed Puerto Madero because it seemed like a small break from the hustle and bustle of Buenos Aires.

it's a "Must go" in BA. Great spot in Buenos Aires, with sidewalks along the river and a nice view. Walking distance from downtown. It's perfect for a stroll and even better if you have time to enjoy a restaurant. I suggest to try seafood or argentinian BBQ.

fancy & nice area of Buenos Aires. nice area of buenos aires with good sightseeing of La Plata River, and good restaurants. they have places at night that play tango shows and the women bridge that is a monument of the city.

Full of restaurants - good place to eat. The Puerto Madeiro was an old port and was remodeled be a cultural and gastronomic zone in Buenos Aires. The place is nice to go for a walk and has many restaurants. It is a place to visit in the morning and then to come back for a meal at night. Most restaurants are not cheap, so if you are in a thigh budget then you should avoid the restaurants.
Beautiful place to walk. It very clean, full of places to eat or have a drink, also there is a museum boat for kids.Try walking from both sides beginning from dock 4
great place. the architectural renovation in this area is amazing people of any age can enjoy to walk around, eat, shop, etcthe history behing every building is very interesting
New luxury development. in the port area this a development of impressing tower buildings for modern hotels with luxury restaurants and bars expensive aparments

excellent fusion of redevelopment and local history. While I wouldn't say people MUST visit this part of town, it's definitely of interest if you like local history and redevelopment initiatives. And bridges by Santiago Calatravo. (apparently this is his only pivoting suspension bridge!) This old seaport looks sparkly new and is flooded with new restaurants lacking soul. But great for walking, and running in the large nature preserve. Rumor has it that the Frigate Museum has a mummified dog...
Tango!. Very good experience, many tango dancers and very good view, very good to be seated and enjoy a beer, or a cup of coffee, very good experience, many colors!

Nice area, good restaurants. Puerto Madero was a great place to go, both during day & night, its very safe, and has a lot of restaurants (some very pricy) overall food options are excellent. there is a boat you can check out that works as a floating museum. -

Nice safe area with good restaurants. Puerto Madero is a nice, quiet area to visit when you are in Buenos Aires. I found it to be a lot cleaner, and I felt safer walking around here. It can get crowded on weekends and holidays when the weather is pleasant.
Nice and expensive. We can find very nice restaurants there, but they usually have expensive food prices. Maybe this is fair to justify the nice outside view.
La Parolaquia. I have lunch in the best area in Buenos Aires at ridiculously cheaper price and the food was delicious.

One of the safety places in BA. This area is full of all type of restaurants, 80% of them are tourist traps! but making the right choice is a beautiful place to have lunch or dinner! overlooking the riverside! residential area with the most expensive buildings in town. During weekends great place to skate, roller, or just enjoy a nice walk. Great place and safe place to walk
Relaxing. Excellent place for an upscale dining with a choice of many types of cuisine.Nice for an afternoon stroll.Great views and overall a very safe area.
Modern. I liked the mix between port and city with docks and shops all around.There's nothing I dislike in Puerto Madero, just is very expensive to eat and drink.

Nice place to find a good restaurant. Puerto madero is where the Buenos Aires docks received boat ships by mid the last century. Now those building were restored and nice restaurants are allocated there, no doubt you will find one to your fit.
Very good restaurants. Good area for walking and one of the safest places day or night for walking in Buenos Aires. It also has some of the best restaurants in the city.

Trendy, but too many restaurants together.. There are good, medium and bad restaurants in Puerto Madero, but the place is safe due to the permanent presence of Prefecture personnel. Some restaurants are too loud, some are almost empty, most menus misspell English, Italian and French words. An Italian restaurant that spells Risotto, Rissotto should be blackballed. OK place for occasional meals. Bice is excellent for its Italian food, like Bice in Milan and New yourk

nice place to visit. All kind of restaurants ( typical parrilla, italian and japanese food) Also a nice place for tea time.Walk over any time mainly since September through March, always you will be enjoy it. You can take a boat for a tour for a nearby visit. At night is beautiful

Great place for a stroll and grabbing a bite. One of the cleanest and safest places in Buenos Aires. Great for relaxing stroll and nice views of the marina. Many chic places to chose from when time for eating or coffee comes. Jogging, riding a bike or skating are also alternatives.
Great place to visit. One of the must to see if you visit Buenos Aires. The restaurants, the Bridge of Woman, great place for visiting if you are in Buenos Aires.

Great atmosphere by the river. Great just for a walk or a nice lunch or dinner by the river, perhaps more attractive in the evening for the atmosphere of the place. Take a walk along the river side and have your choice of food : pasta, fish, beef even pizza according to your whim. There´s plenty for you to choose and enjoy !

Good for a walking late afternnon. It's a big walking street plaint of good restaurants and where the woman bridge ( projecteb by Calatlava - The famous arquitect of Spain). It's a good choice for the late afternoon walking or for a dinner.
A must do in Buenos Aires. Delicious walk... great restaurants... (expensive though)! ... stop by and have one more flavor of Freddo's ice-cream after lunch or dinner and a stroll along the decks.

Where are all the people?. The area looked great with old factory building renovated and now being used as cafés or restaurants. The problem was that we went for weekend lunch and almost every place was deserted! The atmosphere for the area was most certainly lacking. I would recommend asking a local for the time to be here. I assume it's an evening location.Near the bridge you can cross to see an orange wall with a statue of Queen Maxima of the Netherlands (as a girl). Great little find for anyone Dutch.

A ghost town. Perhaps a weekend is the wrong time to visit but it felt absolutely deserted. Obviously a well designed revamp of what would have been an industrial area but it needs people to bring out the best. On this cold and wintry Sunday, it felt isolated and lacked warmth and any interest.
Quality and variety. Pasta, fish, hamburger, barbecue and so on. Wide variety of brands, tastes and prices with an additional view of the river. Must visit, certainly I will return

Worth visiting at night. Here is a place to get a taste of Argentina's selection of cuisine and other culinary choices. The port has been well restored to reflect the best of the Plata River that once was one of the most important harbors in the continent.
I enjoyed puerto madero. I enoyed puerto madero and puente de la mujer and can recommend it to anyone looking to see sophistication in buenos aires
restaurant row. excellent selection of restaurants close by with indoor or outdoor seating wide selection of prices and menues nice to stroll and watch sun set
Delightful Setting. We returned to this area four times for dining. It is sparkling and cherry and has a great ambiance.

Lovely waterfront dining, but not cheap. This area has become gentrified. Very pricey digs, and great Restos to match but not cheap! Lots of Italian, but I learned that at least 50% of porteños are of Italian extraction, so we didn't feel that we were missing out on true BA. Very picturesque walks along the river front

The New, Clean, Modern part of down town.. Puerto Madero is much, much different than the rest of Buenos Aires. It is very new, and appears to be master-planned. Walking areas are large and vast, with not a single crack in the sidewalk! Buildings are big and modern. Big name hotels. Trendy shops, etc. Some pretty good restaurants directly across the waterway as well, in addition to some of the compulsory U.S. themed restaurants. Did you really come all this way to go to Hooters?

A place to relax in Buenos Aires. With no traffic at all , it's a pleasant place to wander around in . Sitting on a bench , enjoying the view of the restored docks and maybe a tasty beer is a way to spend a sunny day at the waterfront .
Very nice place to visit. I always visit Puerto Madero when I visit Buenos Aires, every year something new!! new buildings, new hotels, new restaurants and is always nice to walk and enjoy the view.
Great choice of Restaurants!. Great to stroll around and visit the boat permanently anchored. Choose a canal view restaurant and watch the world pass by.

İt's like a endustrial place.. When I went PM, i thought here is an endustrial place. Later I saw some people, they were running. When I took the car, I saw lake. I didn't like so much. But you can see for if you want say "I saw a lot of place!".

Is was better. Puerto Madero is getting more and more expensive as years goes by. You can't eat a decent meal round there for less than USD 100 (1 wine included). I don't recommend it for budget travelers, but a walk is a must see, with beautiful architecture.

Alright for a walk. This area is along the river. There are quite a few upmarket restaurants here which I did not sample. Not really worth going out of your way for, except on Sunday the boat was free to look at.

Modern Area. Our company offices in Buenos Aires are located in Puerto Madero, so saw a fair bit of the area. It is very new and modern, and the architectural style is different from other areas of the city. I would not want to stay in the neighborhood, but it was nice for a quick walk to escape the office and there were a lot of nice restaurants lining the water.

Meal at the port. Visited here several times- plenty of choice went for Bahia madero- having some knowledge of Spanish is ideal. Friendly service reminds me a wee bit of canary wharf or St Katherine's flock.

Plenty food options, beatiful sightseeing place. It is close to the river, close to historic downtown. Walk and take a look riverside plenty of restaurants from fast food to unforgettable experiences enjoying local options with excellent service.
Lovely area. Modern, clean new with water views. Stopped in the Faena Hotel it is awesome with gorgeous interiors.
Beautiful. Good to walk around. Many modern buildings, restaurants and bars. Beautiful views. When going there come to Faena District too.

A DIFFERENT PLACE IN BUENOS AIRES, GOOD FOOD AND NICE ENVIROMENT. Puerto Madero located close to River Plate river, this place used to be the port for small ships and mainly fiscal warehouse for imports, in beginning 1990´s it was privatized and become a gastronomic complex with many restaurants, offices and appartments for living. This place take aprox 14 blocks from North to South. You will find beside restaurants,nice walking area near the river, some clothes stores, big international hotels, like Hilton and some boutique banks. It is nice to visit night and day with different atmosphere, safe place during the night. There are many restaurants ( meat, fish and pasta ), prices are not cheap but place compensate the cost

Good place to relax. We had a nice walk around the port, there are plenty of cafes and restaurants, quiet but very central too. There are things to occupy kids as well, like a pirate ship, and some nice places for music

Loads of good restaurants!. THis ares is very nice for taking a walk in the afternoon and then getting some dinner afterwards in one of the many nice restaurants you can find there. A must-visit part of Buenos Aires.Visited August 2013

Beautiful area to visit.. There are lots of restaurants in the area. You should always avoid "Cabana las Lilas". The only time I´ve been there was a ripoff and the food and service was terrible. It´s just a name. There are better options in Puerto Madero and off too.

Interesting Experience. The place is very interesting for eating adn just walking by. A must see in the city. The major problem is the lack of public bathrooms (I found only one) and most of the restaurants allow only guest inside.

Lovely area for a stroll and lots of great outdoor restaurants to chose from. We loved walking in this area...lots of space, very clean and not busy. Plenty of great restaurants to dine at and enjoy some steak and malbec...we went back there a few times and always felt safe and relaxed.

nice place to visit and walk plenty of restaurants. I liked the view of the boats restaurants and the river.
It misses some directions to help the tourist
Upscale restaurant area. They restored old warehouses and created a are with upscale restaurants, it is worth at least a visit and stroll. Went to a couple of the restaurants and they were very nice.
Best for a relaxing walk. This place is the best in Buenoo Aires if you are looking for a nice place to walk and have a good meal followed by excellent ice cream!
Stayed at Hilton. This is a great area. Tons of restaurants and sites to see. The Ecological preserve is right next to Puerto Madero as well. Very safe area to walk, even at night
A day exploring the Port. Lovely place to walk, eat, picnic, and explore. You can easily walk there from Corrientes and there are buses to everywhere from there.

Great area for restaurants and walking. I last visited Buenos Aires over twenty years ago and Puerto Madero was not developed then. This "new" area was an incredibly pleasant surprise for me, both for its aesthetic appeal and the restaurant offerings. Our family had a wonderful time walking, jogging and eating in Puerto Maduro.

Nice walk. I went to Puerto Madero to walk around and find a nice restaurant for a romantic dinner. It's a beautiful and safe place any time of the day, lots of restaurants - not cheap ones - and great views. It's a new area, the architecture is completely different from the rest of the city but worth the visit.
Madero. Trendy restaurants and the views of the bridge and the historical ships is impressive. We liked the outside seating

Beautiful to walk around. But not to eat there. Too touristic, you will find much better restaurants around the town.
But you should walk there and have a Quilmes in front of the river!

BA's newest area. A great walk from San Telmo, lots of new upmarket hotels, plenty of eateries & bars, & the Faena Hotel's decor needs to be seen to be believed. The dockland areas are well worth exploring- check out the revolving bridge & diques (dikes). Great for a sunny day's wandering.

Like Baltimore's Inner Harbor. I stayed in Palermo for my first week in BA. It was a bit rough at times, but overall enjoyable. When I flew back from Iguazu, I had dinner at Las Lilas and got to enjoy Puerto Madero. This is a newer part of town with a lot of new development (gentrified?) and it's very clean and put together. It reminded me a lot like Baltimore, Maryland's inner harbor which is also very beautiful and quite romantic for a nice night out.

Chic. This new jewel in the Buenos Aires crown is quite fashionable and consequently, not cheap. We had dinner there, preceded by a visit to the Fortabat Collection, and enjoyed just walking around, simply to get the flavor of it all. For those who can afford it, the ambiance is very pleasant and it's a magnet for tourists.
Nice place. Puerto Madero is a Nice Quist place for stroll along the old harbour. There are several restaurants in the aerea. We had a sandwich and a Quilmes ina café near the frigate, Nice!

Nice place for inline skating or walking. Modern (rebuilt) part of the city along a canal. Not really typical for BsAs or Argentina in general. But it is a popular place, you will meet a lot of people there.
Nice place for a stroll. You have a modern place for a stroll with a view to the canals.It is a modern area with a wide variety of restaurants and cafes in a cosmopolitan place ; safe for tourists.

Calmness of river mixed with modern buildings. We went to Puerto Madero in December 2013. Restaurants were many but we could not get what we wanted 'Chinese Food' and we ended eating at Burger King. We walked along the 'Woman Bridge', taking a few photographs of the surroundings. We visited the frigate, warship museum. Knowledgeable. We walked to the place from the Ministry of Defence. Along the way, we saw many big trucks traveling on the road. So be careful when crossing the road.

The perfect place to sip wine at sunset. I highly recommend Puerto Madero at dusk. Walk arm and arm with someone you love along the boardwalk and chose a classy restaurant with outdoor seating to take a break, order an assorted meat and cheese platter and sip some malbec as the sun sets. If you´re on vacation or even if you live in Buenos Aires, Puerto Madero won´t cease to feel romantic.

great to jog, eat and go out. choose a sunny day to enjoy it more, renewed buildings with apartments and office spaces with several excellent restaurants and a few bars. Asia de Cuba is a restaurant that becomes a night club after 11pm, the best choice around that neighborhood in my opinion. Many people jogging at the end of the day in this beautiful pleasant part of Buenos Aires.

Puerto Madero. It provides for a nice stroll along one of the canals. Many restaurants, some of them exceptional, but quite expensive. The frigate anchored there is worth a visit. I have been to restaurants just as good and quite more economical. But, it is the place to "be seen". That is if you care about being seen.

enjoy a wonderful stroll along the water, drinks and food. They have done a great job remodeling these old warehouses into wonderful restaurants and stores. The majority of the restaurants are upscale and have excellent food yet a bit on the price side.
Definitely to be recommended to get a away from the city and enjoy a different scenery.

Best time to visit- in the evening.. Excellent place. Good views are on the business quartier of Baires and of course on the magically lightned Puente Mujeres by Santjago Calatrava. If you like you can visit the militery ship. But it`s possible just till 6 p.m.

A salute to Santiago Calatrava. Friends in Buenos Aires took me to upmarket Puerto Madero post-dinner one evening. As we walked, I stopped when I spotted a magnificent bridge. The Women's Bridge or Puenta de la Mujer over the Rio de la Plata made me gasp as I have always admired the work of Spanish architect Santiago Calatrava. Later, I learnt that Argentinian businessman Alberto L. Gonzalez underwrote the US$ 6 million cost of the dramatic bridge, unveiled in 2001. Is the bridge meant to represent a tango by a couple? Perhaps. This is a lovely location for a stroll, dotted with restaurants, cafes and public gym areas, because it is traffic-free.
Just walk and enjoy. Walk around and enjoy, Recommended in a sunny afternoon, to relax, eat, drink or just walk, and take a break from the noisy city. Secure place

Lugar bonito, com restaurantes, lanchonetes.. Puerto Madero, é bonito, grande, seguro, lugar com vários restaurantes, lanchonetes, lazer.The place is beautiful, great, security, place with a lot of restaurants, dinners and to walk, ride a bike, skates.

Fun place to catch your breath. Puerto Madero is a great addition to BA. The developed area near the warehouses looks a lot like renovated dock areas of Liverpool or London. The Reserva Ecológica is a great, free place to visit with nice walks and a good view of the river, as well as excellent vistas of the city. We saw some lovely birds and a cuy (at least its bottom!) and lots of interesting plants. We visited in June. It looks like it might be a bit hot and buggy in the summer.
Beautiful place. Great, although it was very cold it's still amazing to walk all the way. there are really good places to eat. If you're into sushi I recommend Sushi Club.

Pretty view. My group of four ended up here on our first night in BA and enjoyed some ice cold margaritas while enjoying the view of the bridges. It's a great spot for people watching and everything stays open late.

Great area to visit - very safe !. Puerto Madero used to be (more than 50 years ago) a place where agricultural products targeted to be exported were stored until ships come to the port. Back in the year 1999, the government decided to rebuild this area. After few years I would consider this zone one of the best in Buenos Aires. The "rebuilding" of the area started with a couple of "docks", hosting restaurants and few companies. Today the whole Puerto Madero area is a city inside the city...... more than 30 blocks long by 10 blocks wide. Very safe ! Do not miss it !
Place to stay. this is a great place to stay, you can walk to lots of attractions and/or the subway to get to others. beware the drivers if you are a pedestrian!!

new developed area. quite a cool place to go to for a nice walk along the water front and great places to eat, like the Mexican café. the bridge looks great lit up at night and a very safe area to walk around at night.

Modern & historical mixture.... Puerto Madero is a perfect spot to see near from the city center.
Here you can find old architecture rebuilded, Coming from the old port of Buenos Aires & transformed into a modern spot with restaurants, bars, nightlife, etc.

Nice Afternoon Walk. I was traveling with friends who all had business to attend to. I had an afternoon to myself and wanted to head out into the nice weather. I am a single female and did not feel unsafe walking around. It was a wonderful way to spend my afternoon especially if you find a nice restaurant for a glass of wine and food (I suggest Happenings).

A place for you. A rebuilt part of the City, with great hotels, awesome restaurants, and interesting views like Puente de la Mujer, Fragata Sarmiendo (very cheap entrance), the great Lola Mora´s sculpture, a very long and pretty waterfront with walkways to have a ride on a bike or just keep on. Sundays are crowded and you can find a flymarket and lot of people at the typical "carritos" tasting the delicious "choripan" or "lomito" sandwich. Don't forget "Reservsa ecológica" if you love birdwatching, nature, and different kind of local plants...
Cool place. Go and enjoy Puerto Madero. Many restauants to visit and the food is so delicious. A cool place u should visit in Buenos Aires.

Try to visit the puerta de la mujer here. This is a place to visit one day and spend the day relaxing , visit the ships, la puerta de la mujer and walk around the beautiful gardens they have around, the place is clean and security is all around, recommended for an afternoon walk with the family.

Good area to walk in. See the restored waterfront area with walkways, the interesting architecture of the rotating Puenta de la Mujer, the high skyline of the adjacent modern residential builldings. Restaurants aplenty.

Canary Wharf of BsAs. Cool area for the day, visit the ecological centre for some great views of the skyscrapers across the grasslands. Hotel Faena has a great bar that is nice for a bit of a change. however all in all it is a but too sterile for me and I much prefer the grittier and personality bursting streets of other parts of BsAs.

Nice pleasant walk - nice way to spend an hour. A nice walk, a chance see the old docks of BA. The area has been gentrified now but still a nice stroll if you´ve just bought ferry tickets at the Buquebus Ferry Terminal (as that is located at the start at one of the ends or Puerto Madero).I finished the walk at Puente De La Mujer

Successful rehabilitation project. The old port, too shallow to receive any more ships, went into oblivion, and for years was a decaying section of the city. In the last 20 years, a progressive rehabilitation has occurred and it's still ocurring, making Puerto Madero one of the most dynamic areas of Buenos Aires. Almost everything is fancy: high rises, expensive restaurants, office buildings and hotels. The prices correlate. The visit is well worth, even if on a shoestring budget. Don't miss the Womens' Bridge.
Puerto Madero. I had some great good and wonderful service with our Malbec wine/ Walked around late at night, very safe.

Nice view. Go to Buenos Aires, Puerto Madero is a must to visit and admire the beautiful countryside location, that location was where Buenos Aires has begun, has lots of history, great restaurants and amazing views.
Nice area. It's a nice place for strolling around in the day. Good people watching and a few great restaurants too.

Walking Area. Puerto Medero is a new area close to downtown. What used to be docks is now new buildings, restaurants and shops with a nice walking path by the canal. The streets are wider with landscaping and less traffic compared to downtown. The perfect location to see Buenos Aries.
good place to go for a walk. nice place, won't take long to walk around. Tons of university students around. A very clean and modern area in B.A. Great Chori Pan food trucks

a remodeled part of the city. this is an old harbour completely transformed to a touristic spot. Very nice restaurants share space with nice condos and a wonderfull view of the canal and the city. It is a nice idea to spend some time walking around specially during the sunset.

Great for a walk. You find lots of restaurants here, some a bit expensive, but all deliver good quality food. It is best to share a main course, serviings in Argentina are always big. Both sides of the Darsenas are pleasant, away from the traffic. Interesting the Puente de la Mujer, which represents a tango dancer.
Very good,specially weekends.. First class art museum. Very good restaurants,amplíe choice. With fine weather,enjoya le for walking ska tiñe,cycling. Highly recommended
INTERESTING PLACE FOR TOURIST. Interesting place if you're lucky enough to find a Guide...some times they are not available...Famous place to see Evita Peron's shrine

Very enjoyable to visit and to walk....... Great relaxing walk, close to the Costanera Sud which is even nicer. Restaurants are fancy but mainly for tourists, food not as good as in the city center and "barrios" and generally overpriced. It is a bit isolated from the center so, if you go at night, go by taxi.

great place to walk outside. Although the water is a murky brown the surrounding stores and cafes, restaurants are quite nice and great to walk around this area. Wide walkways, sidewalks and great views across the river make this a must see. Some of the better restaurants and bars are in this area.

Puerto Madero... A must visit in Buenos Aires. Whether you came for one day or a week , you must visit this brand new Buenos Aires neighborhood. At day or night, for walking, lunch or dinner. Despite the restaurants are expensive, there are many that the price worth the visit. You can walk, sit by the river, skate or rollers, there are so many places to go in this, 2 km long place.

Give a try to Buenos Aires newest neighbourhood. Puerto madero is the fenix bird of Buenos Aires neighbourhoods. It was abandoned for many years and now has become the newest and most expensive area in the city. Fancy hotels and restaurants both sides of the docks looking similar Fisherman´s Wharf in San Francisco, but much bigger. Great for a romantic dinner or, if you have de time, just walking arround to relax. The place is realy close to "costanera sur" a former place for families to go for a walk, now including a tiny natural reserve, were you can see how would be the place if man weren´t there. Great place. Worth the visit.

The modern side of buenos aires. It is the safest and newest neighborhood in town. You will find trendys cafes along a riverside walkaway plus yuppie style during the week and familiar atmosphere in the weekend. Nice to stroll and sunbathe in the parks around. It's ten minutes walking from "ecological reserve": gained terrain that was transformed in a wild park; you wont find much there so would only recommend it for those with plenty of free time in BA

For an American, too American.... This is a newly developed part of the city with such things as TGIFriday's and a very modern boardwalk. The history is hard to see behind the feeling of modern global trendiness. Rich people live 'comfortably' in this ultra-policed part of the city. The good: You do get a sense that Buenos Aires is not just about the past by seeing this part of the city - and the bridge of women is beautiful. It's also a short walk from the Pink House and easily be part of a walking tour of that area.

a must do in Buenos Aires!. this dock was built by irish/english immigrants hence why its so similar to the Liverpool docks. even if you don't want to eat in any of the restaurants, still go for a walk around Puerto Madero, it is a must to get that clear breeze in a massive city like Buenos Aires. there are currently many restaurants offering great deals of all you can eat BBQ....the dock was built
